job_description:
The NSW Department of Planning, Industry and Environment  (DPIE) is looking for a technical Business Analyst to support our digital transformation program by weighing up our current WCMS platforms and providing a recommendation on the best platform to suit our growing needs into the future.Working in a full-time contract until August 2020 and bridging the valley between business and technology, you’ll work closely with internal business stakeholders and the Digital team, translating business requirements into our future state WCMS platform recommendations and roadmap.You will need to have experience in a range of standard Content Management Systems (including but not limited to Drupal, SiteCore, SharePoint, Squiz Matrix, IBM WCMS), ideally having worked on previous WCMS assessment and migration programs.You’ll be a stickler for the details, thrive when given autonomy to deliver your work, whilst also being part of a collaborative & supportive team.  Want something to really sink your teeth into? A major focus and deliverable for this position will be the development and delivery of a business case & recommendations on the way forward for WCMS platforms for the Department. You need to understand how the technology works but will not be hands-on in this role, this will be more about understanding of cost/benefits and Design Thinking capability.What you’ll have:

Proven technical BA experience working within a multi-faceted enterprise
Proven experience working with/on WCMS platforms
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, as well as an eye for the details and a collaborative team player approach

What’s in it for you?

A salary from $97k to $107k pa plus super
New state of the art workspace - Parramatta Square
Direct connection to work from Parramatta train station
On-site world-class premium health and wellness club and child care
Flexible working | Work from home days/start early - finish early
Access to discounted private health insurance, gym memberships, and salary sacrificing options

About us:At the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE) we are focused on creating a liveable, inclusive and sustainable New South Wales with thriving natural environments, strong primary industries and bustling urban centres. We are the stewards of our state’s physical and environmental assets - both natural and built - and we work hard every day to ensure New South Wales continues to flourish.How to Apply:It’s simple! Just apply via the online application process, attaching a resume and cover letter which outlines how your skills and experience match what we are looking for, and we will get back in touch after the closing date.Closing Date:  Monday 24th February 2020 @ 11:55pmFor further information please contact Jeremy Leman, Scrum Master Principal Service Delivery Manager on 0425 239 257 or  jeremy.leman@environment.nsw.gov.au. You can also download the role description.Additional Information:In 2020, the Department of Planning, Industry & Environment is relocating nearly all of its Sydney based workforce to the new Parramatta Office, Parramatta Square, as part of the newest government working hub.A talent pool may be created from this recruitment action for ongoing and temporary roles of the same standard that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.Our commitment to flexible working:The NSW Department of Planning, Industry & Environment is committed to ensuring the sector reflects the NSW community it serves. We support an inclusive workplace where staff have access to opportunities and resources at all levels, enabling our team members to drive innovation, productivity and delivery of high-quality services. We are open to discussing flexible working arrangements and encourage our people to explore new ways of working - including part-time, job-share or working from different locations. Everyone can ask about it.Our commitment to Diversity:The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and people with disability.

job_description: Liberty Specialty Markets, offers specialty and commercial line insurance and reinsurance across Asia Pacific.  The Asia Pacific IT Team is not your usual IT department: Find out what it takes to be part of a global Fortune 100 company that exists to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow.  Global company. Competitive salary and benefits. Career development opportunities. Team-work culture.   What makes us so different? We are looking for someone who believes in and thrives on teamwork – at Liberty, cooperative teamwork is not only paramount within the IT department, but also within Liberty as a whole. IT is seen as a partner, not sub-ordinate to the business and your expertise is highly valued. At Liberty, we strive to work together effectively for the benefit of the wider organisation. We invest in our people and believe a cross-skilled team can achieve a better outcome than individuals with siloed responsibilities and knowledge. You will also benefit from having first-hand experience from the technology investment of a fortune 100 company! Key responsibilities  Gain a clear understanding on systems and related business processes that you are responsible for. Identify and build relationships with your stakeholders; Engaging the business to elicit and accurately document business, functional and technical requirements; Enhance and maintain the use of LSM’s global and regional business applications through working with local or offshore development teams; Provide change management support to the business as part of system changes; Document and model AS-IS and TO-Be business processes; Identify gaps in procedures, recommend changes and uplift or create new procedures; Establish Communication plans for system and project impacts, facilitate workshops & meetings with the assigned business departments.   Qualifications and Soft Skills  Cultural fit is a must! We are looking for someone who has proven track record in building relationships with the business and is not afraid to get involved in a wide variety of work. Whether this is managing projects, playing a role in projects run by others, day to day support work or acting as an advisory to your stakeholders. In this role there is no “typical day”, however it is likely going to involve trying to understand a business problem and using your creativity and understanding of the business processes / systems to come up with solutions.  On a day to day basis, this will take up ~ 50% of your time. The remaining time will be split between working on larger initiatives and leading your own projects. NB: The percentage is an indication only and may change depending on current business priorities. You need to be a self-starter, with a can-do attitude, who is comfortable putting your ideas forward and is able to collaborate across business functions to achieve the best outcome for the organisation. Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in the Insurance or Finance industry Strong knowledge of IT concepts, frameworks and strategies Strong understanding of system development lifecycle including Agile development practices Strong analytical capability – questioning, clarifying and research skills Experience in documenting current state, identifying gaps and solving problems Excellent communication skills and high-level stakeholder engagement skills Ability to work collaboratively within a team and across business units Knowledge of Underwriting systems preferred Degree in business or technical discipline required If you believe you can make a positive contribution to our team and want to be part of Liberty’s exciting future we would love to hear from you. Please click APPLY NOW and attach your resume together with a cover letter on why you believe you can make a difference to Liberty.   Agencies – We’ve got this covered!   We care about your privacy and the protection of your information. Our Privacy Policy is available at https://www.libertyspecialtymarketsap.com/footer/privacy-policy/. By submitting an application for this role, you confirm that you have read, understood and consent to our Privacy Policy and further, that we may store any information you provide in the cloud and/or a third party platform used by the Liberty Mutual Group. You also agree that we may transfer your information to another country, including a country with different privacy laws to that of your own. You further agree that we may store your information for a period of up to 5 years and that we may contact you about relevant employment opportunities with the Liberty Mutual Group.

job_description: Our client is a Government department who is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to work on the implementation of a strategic licensing platform which affects a number of other disparate departments. Role Overview Join an outstanding group who are recognised as innovators and digital disruptors delivering quality to NSW Government. This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst to provide hands on support for the implementation of a new whole of government licensing platform. You will help the Department develop a comprehensive implementation approach for licensing within NSW Government regulators. To succeed in this role, you will be a skilled professional with substantial proven experience (7+ years) as a technically-oriented business analyst in complex application development projects. You will apply your business analysis and analytical thinking skills to deliver innovative ideas and approaches.  Role Deliverables:  Establishment and documentation of detailed requirements for the core MVP platform and relevant licences. Development of a delivery framework for onboarding future licences when the project transitions beyond MVP. Development of a migration approach for licences that will be transitioned into the new solution. Discover and capture key business requirements by establishing stakeholder relationships and facilitating cross-team and department conversations (in workshops, in project teams or one-on-one). Analyse and consolidate information to develop recommendations supporting achievement of business objectives. Provide plain language advice on technical issues to non-technical audiences. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency whilst improving service outcomes and re-imagining what future services could look like. Work with key stakeholders and the project team to identify how changing a proposed solution design may impact business processes and address business requirements. Support the test team by creating test scenarios and acceptance criteria.   To be successful in this role you will have:  Experience driving the analysis of requirements and related BA activities within a government or a large, complex organisation. Demonstrable ability to develop strategies and implementation plans for ICT and business improvement initiatives. The ability to forge new relationships with a wide range of stakeholders including interacting with senior executives. You must have excellent communications and consultative skills. Demonstrable experience in successfully planning and leading workshops with all types of stakeholders, from senior executives to frontline staff and people using services will be critical to the success of this project. Capability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences. Business processes definition and diagramming experience. job_description:
BUSINESS ANALYST
Based in Rockhampton at QMAG Parkhurst site, this integral Business Analyst role reports directly to the Finance Manager.
The key responsibility of the Business Analyst is to provide the Magnesia Performance Team, Leadership Team & business with timely and valueable insights to the business by offering alternatives and area of improvements with respects to revenue generation, cost efficiency & effectiveness, product costing & finance process improvements.  This role will also be the key contact for the Performance Team seeking scenario and costing analysis.
 
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:                                                                                                 
 

Provide insightful and timely cost and process analysis to the magnesia leadership team (monthly & ad hoc)
Develop & maintain accurate and relevant cost reporting suite for management
Lead business case reviews & capital expenditure review & monitoring
Develop & maintain a Post Implemenation Review (PIR) for all capital projects
Develop & maintain scenario modelling capability and models
Lead the Magnesia BU budget and forecast process

 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES:                                                                                                                                                                                                      
 

Develop & maintain strategic business process modeling, traceability and quality management techniques
Implement advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing data requirements
Ensure capital project effectiveness through analyzing, reporting and challenging
Provide insights to the leadership team around cost effectiveness and

Manage month end financial reporting tasks; including P&L Commentary & Analysis
Manage and update the Monthly Performance Report and other reports as required
Support Finance and cross-functional projects with a focus on achieving business improvements and standardization such as system upgrades and implementation.



 
ROLE REQUIREMENTS:
 
Essential:

Bachelor or Masters' Degree in Accounting, Commerce or Finance
CA, CPA or CFA Membership
Demonstrated experience in scenario creation and analysis
Super User level expertise in Microsoft software (excel)
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build positive relationships
Strong analytical skills and data interpretation skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build positive relationships

This role has a salary range of $70,000 - $80,000 plus superannuation.

job_description: Join us in this critical role supporting the business  with expertise in data analysis, insights  and reporting Help drive the continuous improvement of the  business into an efficient growth engine and add value to its service offering as the “partner of choice for connecting health solutions”. Work with a leading Australian organisation with huge impact in the marketplace About Sigma Healthcare  Sigma Healthcare is a leading Australian full line wholesale and distribution business supporting community and hospital pharmacy. We operate a national network of efficient distribution centres to supply products and services to over 5,500 community pharmacies, public and private hospitals as well as institutional health providers.  Sigma healthcare also offers national logistics services supporting manufacturing partners to bring products to market. Sigma Healthcare is the largest pharmacist-led network in Australia, with over 1,200 branded and independent pharmacies including some of Australia’s best-known pharmacy retail brands in Amcal, Chemist King, Discount Drug Stores, Guardian, PharmaSave, PriceSave and Wholelife Healthfoods. We attract and retain talented people with our dedicated workforce, who achieve high performance levels for our customers, suppliers and other stakeholders. Our culture is demonstrated through our behaviours and actions of being Accountable, Respectful, Collaborative, Honest and Innovative. The Opportunity This opportunity is a back fill FTC role until October 21st 2021 based at our Rowville location. Reporting to the Head PMO, the appointed will focus on:    Liaising with business unit managers to offer advice and direction regarding requirements to prioritise   Documenting business processes, needs, and issues for workable, quality, efficient and cost-effective technology and process solutions   Assisting with the preparation of business cases   Analysing and specifying requirements that are uniquely traceable, verifiable and prioritised   Act as an interface between Business, Technology and Projects to ensure that all needs are met   Verifying business requirements using structured testing processes   Validating  that the proposed solution/s meet business needs   Proactively engaging with diverse stakeholder groups in requirement gathering and business activities by planning and facilitating workshops and meetings.   Ensuring project needs are met and aligned to the overall strategy (including technology strategy).    What We Are Looking For   A tertiary qualification in a business or IT discipline; or   Business Analysis certification will be highly regarded but is not essential   Advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills, including accessing and presenting relevant data    You Will Have  5 or more years repeated performance of business analysis in a variety of situations and environments   Proficiency in building effective business relatiosnhips to drive desired results through the context of business analysis   Demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills   Ability to translate technical concepts so they can be understood by all stakeholders   Business analysis, process mapping, analytical tools, i.e. case modelling`   Experience documenting user stories and other supporting analysis   Ability to manage prioritisation, verification and changes to requirements within a solution scope   Ability to negotiate and manage competing priorities within tight timeframes  What’s on Offer When you join Sigma Healthcare you join an Australian success story with over 100  years of proud history and you;  Become a part of a business that plays a unique role in supporting healthy communities   Advance your skills and experience by working on a career enhancing project     Work with teammates to drive our culture of accountability, respect, collaboration, honesty and innovation   Receive a competitive salary package   Enjoy great employee benefits and discounts, including free on-site parking, subsidised on-site café and access to discounted products  All successful applicants will be required to undertake a national criminal background check as a condition of employment. NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES Please note that Sigma does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Sigma will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement for the specific opportunity, Sigma explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Sigma.

job_description: The successful candidate will be working on a broad program of work to analyse current state capabilities and provide opportunities for improvement in the delivery of specific federal management services.The Senior Business Analyst will work in a team of business analysts, with a focus on analysing the business from both user and business outcomes perspectives for the Program. Viiew Consultants are agile and innovative. We work together to achieve great things.

Exposure to industry-leading technology, projects and expertise

job_description:
The NSW Department of Planning, Industry and Environment  (DPIE) is looking for a technical Business Analyst to support our digital transformation program by weighing up our current WCMS platforms and providing a recommendation on the best platform to suit our growing needs into the future.Working in a full-time contract until August 2020 and bridging the valley between business and technology, you’ll work closely with internal business stakeholders and the Digital team, translating business requirements into our future state WCMS platform recommendations and roadmap.You will need to have experience in a range of standard Content Management Systems (including but not limited to Drupal, SiteCore, SharePoint, Squiz Matrix, IBM WCMS), ideally having worked on previous WCMS assessment and migration programs.You’ll be a stickler for the details, thrive when given autonomy to deliver your work, whilst also being part of a collaborative & supportive team.  Want something to really sink your teeth into? A major focus and deliverable for this position will be the development and delivery of a business case & recommendations on the way forward for WCMS platforms for the Department. You need to understand how the technology works but will not be hands-on in this role, this will be more about understanding of cost/benefits and Design Thinking capability.What you’ll have:

Proven technical BA experience working within a multi-faceted enterprise
Proven experience working with/on WCMS platforms
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, as well as an eye for the details and a collaborative team player approach

What’s in it for you?

A salary from $97k to $107k pa plus super
New state of the art workspace - Parramatta Square
Direct connection to work from Parramatta train station
On-site world-class premium health and wellness club and child care
Flexible working | Work from home days/start early - finish early
Access to discounted private health insurance, gym memberships, and salary sacrificing options

About us:At the Department of Planning, Industry and Environment (DPIE) we are focused on creating a liveable, inclusive and sustainable New South Wales with thriving natural environments, strong primary industries and bustling urban centres. We are the stewards of our state’s physical and environmental assets - both natural and built - and we work hard every day to ensure New South Wales continues to flourish.How to Apply:It’s simple! Just apply via the online application process, attaching a resume and cover letter which outlines how your skills and experience match what we are looking for, and we will get back in touch after the closing date.Closing Date:  Monday 24th February 2020 @ 11:55pmFor further information please contact Jeremy Leman, Scrum Master Principal Service Delivery Manager on 0425 239 257 or  jeremy.leman@environment.nsw.gov.au. You can also download the role description.Additional Information:In 2020, the Department of Planning, Industry & Environment is relocating nearly all of its Sydney based workforce to the new Parramatta Office, Parramatta Square, as part of the newest government working hub.A talent pool may be created from this recruitment action for ongoing and temporary roles of the same standard that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.Our commitment to flexible working:The NSW Department of Planning, Industry & Environment is committed to ensuring the sector reflects the NSW community it serves. We support an inclusive workplace where staff have access to opportunities and resources at all levels, enabling our team members to drive innovation, productivity and delivery of high-quality services. We are open to discussing flexible working arrangements and encourage our people to explore new ways of working - including part-time, job-share or working from different locations. Everyone can ask about it.Our commitment to Diversity:The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and people with disability.

job_description: Partner with your assigned business divisions to drive meaningful change delivering value to the people of NSW Be an influencer, decision-maker and expert advisor for complex IT projects  Progressive and dynamic organisation that supports flexible working   Fixed term opportunity, based in Parramatta   The opportunity   Are you an experienced IT Business Analyst looking for an opportunity to join an industry-leading organisation focused on delivering outcomes for the people of NSW?   Right now, we have a 12-month opportunity for an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our Business Services Technology Engagement team in Parramatta.  Technology Engagement manages the end-to-end lifecycle of the Business journey from initial idea to delivery of solution, providing a simplified engagement with IT via dedicated relationship managers. Technology Engagement also converts customer needs to technology outcomes, listens to the requirements of key business stakeholders and translates those into solutions to provide value to the customer and the organisation while being the advocate for IT strategies and capabilities.   As part of the wider Technology Engagement Team you will be working with both business and IT stakeholders ensuring outcomes are understood and prioritised. It is an exciting time, and you in leading IT Innovation by defining and validating the appropriate solution architecture to ensure it aligns with our overall IT strategy and enterprise architecture.   As a trusted business partner and advocate you will be involved in:    The delivery of business analysis across a portfolio of complex initiatives to determine business requirements that support the definition of opportunities to be capitalised or problems to be resolved to optimise business performance   Application of required modelling and analysis tools, methods and standards, giving special consideration to business perspectives   Identifying and implementing solutions to business opportunities/problems on proposed and completed projects across a range of complex initiatives   About you   You are passionate about striving, pushing and advocating for the adoption of industry leading solutions, not simply maintaining the status quo.  You’ve got what it takes to understand highly complex and inter-related technical domains to effectively convey information to multiple audiences.    You have relevant technology, business, project management and/or equivalent experience with demonstrated experience in business analysis. It is essential that you can demonstrate experience analysing business needs and in interpreting and translating analysis results into insightful, clear and succinct technical specifications and requirement documentation.    Your strong knowledge of and extensive experience in the application of business analysis best-practice frameworks such as BABOK, Object Oriented Analysis & Design (e.g. UML), and business architecture (BPM, CBM, capability mapping, etc.) will support your success in this role.    If you understand the challenges of delivering high quality customer focused services, have the ability to operate effectively within a complex work environment and enjoy establishing and managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders, this is the right opportunity for you.     Please note, this role is fixed term for 12 months.    To get a complete profile of the role, please click here.    About us  Transport for NSW is responsible for coordinating transport services used by over 7.5 million residents, 800,000 businesses and 30 million visitors every year. Transport comprises several divisions which coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.   Interested?   If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role we want to hear from you.  Find out more about Transport for NSW here.     Our Commitment to Diversity   Great people come from all walks of life. At Transport for NSW, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.    We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation.   Benefits  When you join Transport for NSW, you become part of a forward-thinking organisation that offers generous working conditions, flexible working options and a real commitment to developing your skills. For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here. The salary for this position is USS 10 ($123,229 - $134,668) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.   To apply  Simply submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than two pages) which must addresses the following statements:    Using an example describe your experience in the facilitation of groups during planning and design activities, change management activities   Describe a time you have partnered with a business stakeholder to drive meaningful change and challenged the status quo   Need help?   For a confidential discussion, please contact Liz Moore on 0437 826 135 or liz.moore@transport.nsw.gov.au (Ref 7LHC).   For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here.    Applications close: 11:59pm Monday 17 February 2020

job_description: Our client is a leading NSW Government Department who are seeking multiple Business Analyst based in Parramatta. You will be working on the integration of current front end systems with the SAP back end. As well as gather reporting requirements, conduct a gap analysis of the existing reports and make recommendations on future state reporting. The chosen candidate will be working closely with SAP Functional Analysts and Developers to understand SAP functionality in relation to the front end system.We will trust you to:   Direct analysis and discussions through workshops and interviews to elicit targeted business requirements that are fit for purpose Collect and analyse information to create viable recommendations to business and technical stakeholders Prepare comprehensive business requirements documents such as that meet the conflicting needs of business stakeholders and achieve operational best practice Review ‘As Is’ process to ensure optimal ‘To Be’ processes Plan to ensure requirements are completed within agreed time frames and are in accordance with agreed customer specification Actively support SAP Functional Analysts in the completion of technical specifications and participate in solution design  We are seeking candidates with:  Experience driving the analysis of requirements and related BA activities within a government or a large, complex organisation. Demonstrable ability to develop strategies and implementation plans for ICT and business improvement initiatives. BPMN process notation Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong stakeholder management skills Excellent communication skills  We would love to see experience with   SAP ERP, particularly Cost model / Finance, HR Master, Supply Chain and Procurement, Enterprise Project and Portfolio Management  You need to have:The ability to work legally in Australia without visa sponsorship now or in the future.If this sounds like you:Apply! Or drop me a line on jmanocha@infopeople.com.au or you can contact me on (02) 8227 4514. If we believe you're a good match, we'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps!Infopeople - Jasprit Manocha

job_description: Business Analyst to be involved in Electronic Document Record Management System upgrade for Local Government.  Your new company This Local Government organisation located in the Eastern Suburbs of Melbourne is currently seeking a Business Analyst to involve themselves in an EDRMS upgrade.  Your new role The Business Analyst will be working closely with the Project Manager and project stakeholders. You will be taking part in an upgrade of their existing Electronic Document Record Management System. Ultimately this project aims to improve the council’s productivity and ability to respond to requests of the locals.  Your typical duties would include:Collaborating with stakeholder and customer groups to elicit, analyse, prioritise, validate, document and communicate business requirements and solution design to support project delivery.Lead the definition of requirements and design of new/re-engineered business processes through effective engagement of stakeholders.Providing recommendations for process improvements and re-design enabling changes to process and policy.Ensuring recommended solutions align to targeted business outcomes using both subjective and objective data that is factual and performance-based.Preparing business impact and risk assessments for the proposed change and/or recommended business solution.Managing/developing detailed Business Process Specifications, Business Requirements and System Functional/Non-FunctionalManage specifications to drive desired change to business process, system enhancement/development activitiesEnsuring BA deliverables align to the standards and expectations set.Completing process analysis and design activities aligned with process standards as requested.Requirements owner for agreed projects within a delivery stream, representing the requirement intent and ensuring Vendor deliverables trace and align to business requirements. What you'll need to succeedExperience working on an EDRMS upgrade project.Strong BA skills including elicitation for functional and non-functional requirements, requirements management and traceability.Ability to articulate business analysis outcomes (process maps, business processes, work flow and system design) both in writing and via verbal communicationsDemonstrated ability to collect, collate, analyse and document business requirements from diverse stakeholder groups.An ability to plan, prioritise and organise project tasks in order to meet deadlines.Highly developed interpersonal and negotiating skills with the ability to communicate and work collaboratively with a range of stakeholders.Previous experience within the local or state government sector (Desirable). What you'll get in return A 7-month contract, attractive day rate and the ability to work in a Business Analyst role delivering a key project which will have a major impact on all areas of the local government organisation.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV through to Jenny Thang at Hays Melbourne. Alternatively, email: jenny.thang@hays.com.au  SA Licence number : LHS 297508

job_description:
Mine Super is an industry super fund and since 1941 we’ve been committed to the retirement outcomes of our members and being a trusted super partner in the communities we serve. 
Why Mine?
We pride ourselves on creating a workplace that celebrates collaboration and putting our members first. We run at a fast pace, with an enduring commitment to delivering our best efforts, every day. We’re proud of the benefits we offer which support work / life balance and professional growth and development. With offices in Newcastle, Sydney, Brisbane and regional centres across Australia, we offer employment opportunities across a range of fields.
What you will be doing 
The Senior Business Analyst supports IT and Business Projects in defining, analysing and documenting business cases and requirements for both strategic and tactical projects.
This position acts as the conduit between end-users and IT to ensure that business/ user requirements delivered in IT solutions. Analysing and delivering business process initiatives by either managing some components of large initiatives or all parts of medium-sized initiatives. Meeting with user groups to gather and analyse end-user requirements and producing technical specifications to communicate user requirements in technical terms to programmers/project team. Sound ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate technical solutions.
In this role you will be required to perform the following functions:

Understand, analyse and document the scope and business requirements for strategic and tactical project initiatives
Provide support for the development of business cases
Provide support to Project Managers during project scoping, planning and execution
Create and take ownership of key project artefacts including current and future state business and system processes, requirements, and specifications
Work with the Project Managers to define and implement standard operating models for business analysis within the IT and Business functions
Prepare business impact assessments and gap analyses
Take a lead in ensuring all assigned project objectives are met and the quality of deliverables meets requirements and provides the necessary business outcomes 
Develop standard processes and procedures for requirements management and contribute to their continuous improvement 
Present business analysis findings to key stakeholder groups

Who we’re looking for
The successful candidate for this 6 month contract will have 5 to 7 years demonstrated experience within a similar role in IT, with a proven track-record of accomplishments. Experience working in superannuation or diversified financial services organisations are highly desired.

Weekly travel to Mine's head office in Newcastle will be required.
Qualification profile

Bachelor’s degree in business, science, science engineering, or economics (desired)

Essential experience profile 

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as experience contributing to discussions at a senior level
Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues, clients, and key stakeholders
Strong influencing and negotiating skills
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and issues
Proven experience solving business problems
Ability to work within a self-directed culture and navigate ambiguity
Experience and commitment to structured document management
Demonstrated experience working as part of and contributing to project teams
Possess intermediate to advanced level skills, knowledge and experience in the practical application of Microsoft Office applications including but not limited to Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint and Outlook

What’s in it for you?
At Mine Super, we’re committed to investing in our people and creating a great place to work. We offer diverse career opportunities with a focus on development and growth. Our people enjoy excellent employee benefits, workplace flexibility and a great working environment. 
If you are interested in this exciting opportunity 
please submit your covering letter and resume by using the Apply Now button.

Please be aware that it is a requirement of this position that background checks are completed. 
The background checking process includes reference checking and validation of employment; proof of qualifications; proof of rights to work within Australia; bankruptcy check; directorship check; and a police check. 

Mine is seeking applications from internal and external applicants. Agency submissions will not be accepted.

For more information visit who we are and careers on our website.

The ideal Senior Business Analyst will possess:Experience in developing and producing business analysis artefacts including business process documentation, traceability matrices and business cases.Relevant professional qualifications (e.g. CCBA, CBAP), exposure to design thinking or lean six sigma methods and/or extensive experience in Business Analyst roles (5+ years).Demonstrated ability to cultivate and maintain productive and collaborative working relationships, partnerships and networks to anticipate and negotiate changes in client expectations and requirements.To apply for this well paid Senior Business Analyst contract, please click the Apply for this job button or call Matt on (02) 6299 1006.

job_description: Enex Consulting was formed in 2014 by industry veterans from the enterprise software delivery and testing industry, in partnership with local and global clients to specialise in large program delivery, DevOps alignment and organisational digital transformations.We focus on delivering our clients program objectives by partnering with them to transform their existing IT landscapes into their future Digital Vision on time and within budget.We have 2 positions for Agile Business Analysts for an immediate start with a large financial services client. We are seeking candidates with strong problem solving skills, who possess the ability to adapt and work independently and autonomously. Required Technical skills / experience:   Demonstratred experience as an end-end Business Analyst in an Agile environment.  Proven Scrum Agile experience and qualifications Highly technical business analyst project experience Strong Stakeholder management experience, particularly in liaising between Business & IT functions to initiate and implement the development, delivery and support of solutions. Exceptional standards in workshop facilitation and requirements documentation  High degree of ability to communicate and build trust to forge strong relationships with business, customer & IT bases Excellent written & oral communication skills with demonstrable ability in a variety of techniques to express technical information to non-technical readers / listeners  Additional Desirable Skills   Financial services industry experience Experience ideally within large integration projects Experience with onboarding processes ideal  To be successful in this role you will have a growth mindset, enjoy working in an agile environment and have fantastic communication and planning skills. You will be highly organised with incredible attention to detail and will enjoy working collaboratively in a fast paced environment with a high performing team.Only successful applicants will be contacted. For more information, please contact Cindy Wheeldon at cindy@enexconsulting.com.au or 0439 072 924.NO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES PLEASE.

job_description: Agile Business Analyst - Immediately required is an exceptional Agile BA to join one of Australia's most innovative financial services businesses. Agile Business Analyst - We are looking for BA's that have worked with product owners, developers and designers to deliver world class online products. Ideally you have held the role of Digital BA or Iteration Manager in a Digital team.  Agile Business Analyst - You will be responsible for the delivery of analysis across a portfolio of software and web projects. This will include; Writing and communicating user stories, leading and facilitating workshops, facilitation/co-facilitation of Agile rituals, story elaboration/walk-throughs and workshops work with senior stakeholders to drive requirements as user stories, assisting Product Owners with managing and prioritisation of Product Backlog, champion ongoing process improvement initiatives to implement best practices for Agile Project Management. Agile Business Analyst - You will have the following experience:   Agile/SCRUM Business Analysis Financial Services  Requirements Gathering and Analysis Delivery of Online Projects & Products Mapping and re-Engineering Business Processes Agile Project Management tools eg: Jira/Greenhopper, Rally   Agile Business Analyst - This is a fantastic opportunity for an Agile expert to join a fast paced, progressive technical environment that embrace all things Agile.  If your experience matches the above, APPLY!

job_description:
12 months contract
Role based in Sydney / Melbourne
Leading telecommunication company

About the role
Seeking an experienced Business Analyst will be responsible for defining and managing the operational requirements for residential product related projects. In this role, the BA will support the identification and definition of solutions that will maximize the value delivered to the stakeholders.
Tasks and Responsibilities: 

Complete Planning with relation to business analysis activities.
Participate in project kick off, to gain understanding of the project scope, resources and timeline, and any non-standard aspects to the project.
Elicit, define and communicate operational requirements during the requirements phase.
Document the tracing of requirements into the solution, and report gaps.
Ensure effective communication between team members and all external and internal stakeholders.
Report hazards and incidents in accordance with the management system.

Skills & Experience:

Extensive experience working in a telecommunications environment working as Business Analyst.
Proven experience in establishing and managing functional and non-functional requirements baseline for product, technology and/or system development projects, throughout the entire project lifecycle.
Demonstrated understanding of service/ network management operations in telecommunications with in depth knowledge of service activation and assurance processes.
Previous experience in developing and maintaining process documentation.
Strong experience in in facilitating workshops and meetings.

Please note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted
Click APPLY or contact Mamata Shrestha, Associate Account Manager for confidential discussion or send your resume to mamata.s@interpropeople.com

job_description: Excellent remuneration packages available for suitable candidates Permanent Full-Time Opportunity Various upcoming and exciting projects SYDNEY As Australia's largest privately owned IT Services Company conducting business Australia wide and in the Asia Pacific region, Dialog's key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies and methodologies. Dialog is a dynamic organisation which offers attractive career development to its people through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere.​ Dialog seeks people who have these capabilities:  Extensive experience as a Business Analyst End-to-end requirements gathering Excellent document development skills Extensive stakeholder management experience Process mapping expertise Experience in large and diverse projects and programs Dialog enjoys long-term relationships with Australia’s Peak Government and Corporate organisations. As a Dialog consultant engaging with these clients you will:  Work with key stakeholders to achieve world's best practice processes in major projects Work on a wide variety of interesting and challenging assignments Work with colleagues in partnership with clients who are committed to achieving their business objectives Enjoy salary above industry standard in a working environment in which effort, creativity and a positive attitude are highly valued Have extensive training opportunities through the Dialog Academy, which offers over 1,500 IT and 800 Business Skills courses Work with like-minded colleagues who share information and focus on the goal, driving the project and their careers further and faster Established in 1979, Dialog employs over 1,200 people throughout Australia, and provides a wide range of information technology solutions to government and corporate clients.At Dialog, our whole approach is based on four key values: Involved, Committed, Can Do, Always.It's these values, applied to every project, which stand behind our success and ensure we are always client focused. These same four values underpin the relationship we enjoy with our people.Join our team of professional, enthusiastic and experienced consultants, where communication, learning and knowledge sharing are prized. We offer an excellent benefits package.Dialog is an equal opportunity employer. Visit our website www.dialog.com.au for more information.

job_description: The BlueRock team are looking for an enthusiastic and driven business analyst to join our growing Business Systems team. Are you passionate about all things related to Business Systems and Technology and keen to work with some of Australia’s most innovative starts-up and entrepreneurs?  This opportunity provides the lucky candidate to not only work for a Digital Agency and Consultancy, but one within Australia’s most progressive entrepreneurial Advisory firms. Who are we?  The broader BlueRock group is an entrepreneurial Advisory firm with expertise across every aspect of business and private wealth. Whether it’s financing a start-up, building a website, creating a lease, planning a wealth creation strategy or all the above, our whole team works together to get exceptional outcomes - plus we have a heap of fun along the way!    Voted 4th Best Place to Work in Australia 2018 (between 100 and 999 employees category) A certified B-Corporation company on a mission to use the power of business to solve social and environmental problems  A rapidly growing firm focused on community and becoming a social enterprise An inclusive and diverse workplace culture centred on health and wellbeing through sports comps, free lunches, firm-wide personal development, retreats and Friday Festivus!   What do we do? BlueRock Digital is a digital agency and consultancy that specialises in intelligent digital strategy, development, systems consulting, design and marketing. We work holistically with our clients to harness the power of Digital to drive meaningful growth and efficiencies for their businesses, leaning on the skills and experience of the broader BlueRock community to add value and expertise.  We’re a rapidly growing team on the look-out for Melbourne’s best business analysts to join us through this exciting period of growth. In fact, our mission is to build a highly integrated community of exceptional minds who can work together to challenge industry norms. We help business grow and change by building clear digital strategies and integrate best of breed cloud-based software with business processes. We use these tools to improve profitability and empower business owners with clear data for decision making. From start-ups to established, eCommerce to lead generation, construction to hospitality, no day is ever the same. It’s fast paced, but fun and you’re guaranteed to learn loads along the way.  Who are we looking for? The Business Systems Technical Analyst role is based at our Melbourne office and will throw you into exciting and varied client-facing projects. It will give you the chance to dig into real problems from the start – contributing as much as you’re learning. You will get a taste of what it is like to work with small to medium business and national brands, on live projects and make an impact. We are looking for a creative technical problem solver who has the confidence to get in-front of clients, is passionate about their career and looking to become an integral part of a dynamic and growing team. Someone who possesses outstanding analytical skills and is willing to be flexible and adaptable to our dynamic culture and client base.  About the Candidate (Who we are looking for):  A masters or bachelor’s degree majoring in a discipline such as Software Engineering, Information Systems or Information Technology Up to 3 yrs experience as a Business or Systems Analyst (Experience within a professional services firm is ideal, but not mandatory) A passion for business systems and technology Ability to translate business requirements to accurate documentation, developing testing plans and implementing structured procedures Applying quantitative methods to study and make recommendations regarding various business issues, including business process improvement, customer profitability, resource optimisation and customer segmentation Business acumen, business consulting and general accounting knowledge.  Microsoft Power BI governance and delivery, Query Editor and experience connecting to various data sources (API, SQL server and other data) Process automation experience – using existing tools suitable for SMBs such as Zapier, as well as scripting solutions such as Python, VBA and similar Cloud integration experience – both native integrations set up and process mapping, along with custom API scripts Working with system developers and designers to identify, diagnose, and document problems and errors in specific components of an existing system, assessing how well a product adheres to usability and ability to meet business needs High-level ability to understand and apply various development code to prototype and/or test solutions. We don’t expect this role to be working on full stack software engineering   HubSpot configuration and development &/or integration experience Exposure to any of the following applications: Excel VBA, DAX and Power Query, Xero, DEAR Inventory, Office365 and SharePoint, WorkflowMax, ReceiptBank, Deputy, Kounta   If this sounds like the right fit for you, don't delay and apply now.**Please only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview**Even though it's 2020, it still needs to be said:We don't just accept diversity at BlueRock, we celebrate it. We're proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an employer of choice. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of age, citizenship, colour, disability, gender and gender identity, marital status, nationality, race, sexual orientation or veteran status.  Recruitment Agencies:Please be advised that BlueRock or any of its related or controlled entities do not accept unsolicited resumes from Recruitment Agencies. BlueRock will not recognise an entitlement to an introduction or placement fee unless the Agency has been briefed by a member of the Performance & Culture team on a specific position for which we have requested candidates for. We are not currently considering additions to our list of preferred suppliers.

job_description: Who is Araza:  Araza is a leading Australian based consulting and services organisation. We partner with our clients to improve their business performance through the implementation and delivery of business and technology projects.   Our people are our biggest asset and we want to continue building on our success.  At the beginning of the business in 2013, it was our mission to build an IT consulting firm that was GREAT.   In 2020 we are still working hard at being great. With more than 300 consultants Australia wide (and counting), we are proud to be a consulting firm that is growing fast, focused on outcomes and still in touch with our values.   ### Must be an Australian Citizen ### What is the purpose of this role?  To produce artefacts including tooling rationalisation analysis, business requirement documents, functional specifications as required, business process maps, requirements traceability matrices, user stories and use cases as inputs to a business coding environment design.    Essential Skills:  Experience in developing and producing business analysis artefacts including business process documentation, traceability matrices and business cases. Relevant professional qualifications (e.g. CCBA, CBAP), exposure to design thinking or lean six sigma methods and/or extensive experience in Business Analyst roles (5+ years). Demonstrated ability to cultivate and maintain productive and collaborative working relationships, partnerships and networks to anticipate and negotiate changes in client expectations and requirements. Experience in planning and facilitating workshops to elicit business requirements, and work with subject matter experts to develop coding environment designs, in line with the enterprise architecture, patterns and practices. Experience or exposure to software development lifecycle methodologies and code management best practices. Well-developed interpersonal, negotiation and communication skills, including the ability to establish positive working relationships with the project working group.        What we give to you: (It’s pretty simple, but not common)   A company that cares for their people. Gender equity, in both roles and remuneration throughout the organization Truly talented, switched on and collaborative team members that help each other to succeed.     We have countless events throughout the year from weekly lunches, Araza women presents, Araza Fit, Araza Red (donate blood), Araza Nerds and our end of year celebrations.    If Araza has caught your interest, then please apply now. We would love to meet you and tell you more about our amazing company.    ***We thank you in advance for your application and advise that only candidates that meet the position requirements and have Australian working rights will be contacted.***    Please click on the APPLY NOW tab and send through an updated copy of your resume detailing recent relevant experience

job_description: Permanent and 10 month Fixed Term Opportunities availableCommitment to closing the gender gapCommunity engagement program focused on homelessnessWe’re REA  An Australian start-up success story we’re quietly proud of.  From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we’re humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995, and we now have businesses across Australia, Asia, India and North America.  Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you’re at on your property journey, we’re here to help on every step - whether that’s buying, selling, renting or renovating.  Some of our brands include realestate.com.au, realcommercial.com.au, spacely.com.au, flatmates.com.au and hometrack.com.au.  What we’re doing:  With us, you’ll experience Empowerment. The Senior Business Analyst, Sales and Marketing Enablement role sits within the Customer Product & Experience Group. The Customer Product & Experience Group drives product activities across REA’s sites, apps and other engagement channels. It’s accountable for growing revenue, improving customer satisfaction and strengthening brand reputation. It is segmented into three groups, Core Products, Emerging Products and Customer Channels and Platforms.  The Sales and Marketing Enablement tribe sits within the Customer Channels and Platforms group. The Customer Channels and Platform Group is made up of three tribes, Channels and Experiences, Core Services and Sales and Marketing Enablement. The Customer Channels and Platforms group mission is to provide the foundations to enable the delivery of world class customer products and experiences.  The Sales and Marketing Enablement tribe focus is on revolutionising the way our sales and marketing teams work. Since the roll out of Salesforce, we are embarking on the next wave of digital transformation that leverages the huge amount of data to drive meaningful customer experiences and support seamless digital processes that span product definition to supporting the customer lifecycle including lead capture through contracting for our Residential, Commercial, Developer and Media teams, as well as other functional areas.  The Senior Business Analyst supports the Sales and Marketing Enablement tribe in the following ways: Understanding complex business landscapes and clearly articulating business needs from a varied group of stakeholders.Translating business requirements into clear, concise, testable and accurate user stories & process flows.Liaising heavily with Delivery Teams (Product Managers, Operations, UI/UX, Software Developers and Quality Analysts to understand functional requirements.Ensuring that requirements are understood through story kick offs and constant communication using a variety of analysis and documentation techniques including the application of visualisation techniques to underpin joint understanding of processes and data.Working closely with Product Managers to understand and advise on how the requirements are implemented.Communicating any requirement dependencies, issues or risks identified through the analysis process and contributing to the team’s understanding and prioritisation during planning meetings, retrospectives and Showcases.Contributing to the REA BA Guild and mentoring/coaching junior-mid level BAs in the team.What we’re looking for: Someone with a few runs on the board - 5 years BA experience in a CRM environment (ideally Salesforce) in med-large (>500 users) environmentVery good written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to run workshops and to communicate effectively with Product Managers, Developers, Consultants, End Users and other stakeholders across the organisationExperience using Agile and Lean methodologiesExperience in gathering and developing detailed functional requirements and conducting systems analysis for front and back end applicationsExperience working in large organisations with complex and highly varied business functionsLooks at tricky situations through a solutions-focused lensBusiness, Commerce or Technical degree, or equivalent industry experienceWork productively in a fast paced and agile environmentBut we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection, acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be: Savvy minded and have the ability to think a little left of field / outside the boxA strong and creative communicatorFriendly, approachable and have good relationship management skillsAn avid supporter of our fully inclusive culture - we celebrate difference and ensure that everyone belongsThe REA Experience  The physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development - both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something that we take seriously.  We offer: Onsite health and wellbeing programs, including yoga and meditation classes, and weekly massagesBecause We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your communityHack Days so you can bring your big ideas to lifeAn additional day of leave just for your birthdayA flexible working environment meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes, our leaders fully understand the flexible working policy)Industry leading gender-neutral parental leaveIf you like the sound of us, then we think you should apply today. While we take a look at your application, we encourage you to get to know us a bit more through our various social channels.

job_description: The CompanyOperating in a highly competitive and dynamic financial services environment, QSuper manages around $113,000 billion in funds for over 585,000 members and is committed to working with our members so they can feel more confident they are making the best choices for their situation. QSuper Limited and QInvest Limited are ultimately owned by the QSuper Board of Trustees.The QSuper Group has approximately 1,200 employees, and our culture is one where "members are at the heart of everything we do". Our employees bring this culture to life by behaving in line with our unique values which ensures our success through our actions every day.The RoleWe’re currently seeking a collaborative Senior Business Analyst with excellent stakeholder engagement skills to join our team on a permanent basis. Working on a high-impact project and operating at an enterprise level, you’ll have the ability to shape and define strategic initiatives into actionable projects. You’ll apply your exceptional analysis skills and inquisitive approach to identify and understand business problems, and to prioritise solutions.  Reporting to the Team Leader - Business Analysis and working closely with business and project stakeholders, you’ll accurately define current and future state processes using BPMN and/or other visual methods. You’re experienced operating in a fast-paced, Agile environment and thrive on working across high-stake projects where you can showcase your communication skills and make a genuine impact. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you today!  Skills, Experience and QualificationsAs a Senior Business Analyst, ideally, you’ll have:Extensive experience working in a Senior Business Analyst role, operating at an enterprise level, ideally within the financial services industryAbility to shape and define a business strategy into actionable projects, including appropriate business case and cost/benefit analysisAbility to define a business problem and break it down into an achievable iterative solution, working on tight timeframes and utilising business canvas modelling and Agile/adaptive delivery methodsAbility to define and manage business architecture, aligning service design and customer journeys into the architectureExcellent facilitation skills, with the ability to uncover opportunities by conducting feasibility studies and detailed needs analysisHighly effective planning, elicitation and management of business requirements throughout the project lifecycleExcellent stakeholder management and communication skills, working with varied stakeholders from across the organisation.At QSuper we are proud to champion respect and we value diversity amongst our employees to support an inclusive workplace. We are passionate about selecting talented people based on their qualifications, capabilities and experience relevant to the role.  What you do today inspires tomorrowClick on the 'Apply’ button and follow the prompts. The closing date for applications is Wednesday, 19 February 2020.  Please note, owing to a high volume of applications, QSuper reserves the right to close the applicant portal ahead of this deadline if necessary. So, don’t delay - apply now!Whilst all applicants will be carefully considered, we will only be able to personally contact those candidates that are short-listed for interview.We choose to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this opportunity, so if you’re interested, please apply.

job_description:
About Kmart
With more than 200 stores and employing over 34,000 people, Kmart is proud to be one of Australia and New Zealand’s largest and most successful retailers.
Serving the needs of Australian families is at the core of who we are as a business, that’s why we are driven to be the place customers rely on for low prices and making every day living brighter.
Culture
You’ll be joining a dynamic team with a fantastic culture where diversity is openly celebrated, and you’ll be challenged and supported to achieve personal and business goals. Expect a work environment that is highly collaborative, fast-paced, inclusive and progressive - with no two days the same!
What we’re looking for?
Kmart currently has a requirement for two Merchandise Data Business Analysts to join the Merchandise team.  This role will be responsible for building a data governance operating model and data governance roadmaps including strategic priorities.
You will strive to ensure sustainable, relvant solutions to business data problems are explored, assessed and delivered as well as researching future trends and ensuring project activities and roadmaps are aligned with business, change and communication strategies.
About You
To be successful in this role, your previous experience in data govenance related roles, coupled wih your industry knowledge around data integrity and data protection management practices will hold you in good stead.
Your skills and experience in the following areas will also help you succeed:

Change management – liaising wih stakeholders and leading as an agent of change both formally and informally;
Communicating and influencing is a collaborative and profeesional manner is essential to this roles success;
Delivering Governance projects wilst ensuring business processes are continuously analysed and improved.

Our benefits

Development opportunities across Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group
Excellent remuneration, a generous bonus scheme and access to the Wesfarmers share plan
Discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks
Support of flexible working
Casual dress and free onsite parking

job_description: The Opportunity The Catholic Diocese of Maitland-Newcastle is seeking a Business Analyst to provide business analysis for IT projects. The Diocese is currently undertaking a program of work to consolidate key Diocesan IT functions with Catholic Schools IT functions. These functions include consolidation of O365 and SharePoint sites, changes to records management across the organisation and consolidation of key network and infrastructure elements. This role will take a lead position supporting the business by gathering & clarifying requirements and business processes during delivery of this program. Critical to the success of this role are the relationships with business stakeholders and the incumbent’s ability to gather and translate business requirements that drive the successful delivery of business benefits. This position will also contribute to building the important relationship between Technology Services and the Business by translating requirements into effective IT solutions and aligning with the IT project management strategies. This is a maximum term full-time position for 12 months.  Join Us and Make a Difference to the Community The Diocese of Maitland-Newcastle serves the Hunter and Manning regions which have a population of some 150,000 Catholics. Through its parishes, pastoral groups, and its agencies of Catholic Schools, CatholicCare, St Nicholas Early Education and other agencies, the diocese provides pastoral, educational, social welfare, and community development. The Diocese employs approximately 3,500 staff across these agencies. About You  You are a tertiary qualified and/or industry certified Business Analyst, with experience and analysis expertise in a diverse Information Technology environment; You have demonstrated experience building successful stakeholder relationships with the ability to gather and translate business requirements to successfully deliver project outcomes;  You are able to demonstrate previous success in contributing to the successful delivery of Information Technology projects. Benefits of Working With Us  Receive an attractive salary; Receive 3 additional days leave, Bishop Leave, between the Christmas and New Year period; Ongoing training and development opportunities; A great friendly environment of dedicated and passionate co-workers; Employee assistance program; Discounted gym membership. Selection Criteria Essential  Graduate qualifications and 5 years Business Analyst experience; or extensive experience and analysis expertise in a diverse Information Technology environment with Industry certification; Demonstrated experience in stakeholder management and project governance frameworks including but not limited to initiation, delivery, risk, issue and change management principles; Demonstrated ability to develop Business Cases, conduct cost/benefit analysis, and develop benefit and ROI models; Extensive experience engaging and leading analysis with external partners and IT service providers; Demonstrated capability in strategic business process modelling, traceability and quality management techniques; Knowledge and experience with system engineering concepts, development frameworks and delivery methods (agile experience would be an advantage); Demonstrated capability in implementing advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing data requirements, prioritizing requirements and creating conceptual models; Experience and familiarity with collaboration tools, particularly SharePoint, Teams, O365 and records management across an organization; Experience and familiarity with networks and infrastructure projects.   Desirable  Familiarity with networks and soft telephony systems. For more information about the role, including the position description visit https://www.mn.catholic.org.au/about/careers/positions-vacant/ or you can contact the Project Manager, Fiona Hanson on 02 4979 1270. To Apply To be considered for the position please provide a copy of your current resume and a cover letter individually addressing each of the essential and desirable criteria. *Please note that not adequately addressing the selection criteria will result in your application not being shortlisted.* Applicants may be required to undertake a national police check, hold a current employee Working With Children Check, complete a health assessment declaration, hold a current NSW driver's licence, and must have the ability to work within Australia.  Applications close 11.59 pm on Friday 21 February 2020

job_description: Partner with your assigned business divisions to drive meaningful change delivering value to the people of NSW Be an influencer, decision-maker and expert advisor for complex IT projects  Progressive and dynamic organisation that supports flexible working   Fixed term opportunity, based in Parramatta   The opportunity   Are you an experienced IT Business Analyst looking for an opportunity to join an industry-leading organisation focused on delivering outcomes for the people of NSW?   Right now, we have a 12-month opportunity for an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our Business Services Technology Engagement team in Parramatta.  Technology Engagement manages the end-to-end lifecycle of the Business journey from initial idea to delivery of solution, providing a simplified engagement with IT via dedicated relationship managers. Technology Engagement also converts customer needs to technology outcomes, listens to the requirements of key business stakeholders and translates those into solutions to provide value to the customer and the organisation while being the advocate for IT strategies and capabilities.   As part of the wider Technology Engagement Team you will be working with both business and IT stakeholders ensuring outcomes are understood and prioritised. It is an exciting time, and you in leading IT Innovation by defining and validating the appropriate solution architecture to ensure it aligns with our overall IT strategy and enterprise architecture.   As a trusted business partner and advocate you will be involved in:    The delivery of business analysis across a portfolio of complex initiatives to determine business requirements that support the definition of opportunities to be capitalised or problems to be resolved to optimise business performance   Application of required modelling and analysis tools, methods and standards, giving special consideration to business perspectives   Identifying and implementing solutions to business opportunities/problems on proposed and completed projects across a range of complex initiatives   About you   You are passionate about striving, pushing and advocating for the adoption of industry leading solutions, not simply maintaining the status quo.  You’ve got what it takes to understand highly complex and inter-related technical domains to effectively convey information to multiple audiences.    You have relevant technology, business, project management and/or equivalent experience with demonstrated experience in business analysis. It is essential that you can demonstrate experience analysing business needs and in interpreting and translating analysis results into insightful, clear and succinct technical specifications and requirement documentation.    Your strong knowledge of and extensive experience in the application of business analysis best-practice frameworks such as BABOK, Object Oriented Analysis & Design (e.g. UML), and business architecture (BPM, CBM, capability mapping, etc.) will support your success in this role.    If you understand the challenges of delivering high quality customer focused services, have the ability to operate effectively within a complex work environment and enjoy establishing and managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders, this is the right opportunity for you.     Please note, this role is fixed term for 12 months.    To get a complete profile of the role, please click here.    About us  Transport for NSW is responsible for coordinating transport services used by over 7.5 million residents, 800,000 businesses and 30 million visitors every year. Transport comprises several divisions which coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.   Interested?   If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role we want to hear from you.  Find out more about Transport for NSW here.     Our Commitment to Diversity   Great people come from all walks of life. At Transport for NSW, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.    We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation.   Benefits  When you join Transport for NSW, you become part of a forward-thinking organisation that offers generous working conditions, flexible working options and a real commitment to developing your skills. For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here. The salary for this position is USS 10 ($123,229 - $134,668) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.   To apply  Simply submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than two pages) which must addresses the following statements:    Using an example describe your experience in the facilitation of groups during planning and design activities, change management activities   Describe a time you have partnered with a business stakeholder to drive meaningful change and challenged the status quo   Need help?   For a confidential discussion, please contact Liz Moore on 0437 826 135 or liz.moore@transport.nsw.gov.au (Ref 7LHC).   For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here.    Applications close: 11:59pm Monday 17 February 2020
