job_title: Senior Business Analyst- IT - People & Capability
job_description:
Who are we?
At Target, we believe a better life is one that’s lived, not with more things, but with things that mean more. A life where quality is always valued over quantity. Where beauty is born from style and substance in equal measure. A better way of life, that’s within easy reach of all. That’s why everything from the products we make to the experience we create is crafted with intention and a single purpose to inspire families to live better. 
What will you do?
We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst - IT - People and Capability to join our  Team based in our Store Support Office in Williams Landing in the West of Melbourne. This role is vital to ongoing technology engagement and delivery to the People & Capability systems. This analyst role provides engagement and functional analysis and support to the Target People & Capability team. This includes the soon to be implemented Success Factors system, workforce management (Kronos) and Learning Management Systems.
Other key responsibilities may include:

Requirements Analysis & Solution Design - To evaluate business needs and lead the design and development of the business functional solution including user interface
Process Improvement - Review business process and propose improvements that are based on efficiency and productivity
Leadership - Develop team and individual capabilities to continuously improve service provided to the business and within IT
Project & Change Management - Assist in facilitating change across the business effectively. Ensures project timelines and budgets are met

What are we looking for? - 
Our Ideal candidate will have at least 5 years Business Analyst/Systems Analyst experience. Excellent oral and written communication skills,good analytical and reporting skills is also a requirement for this role. Experience in understanding user needs be able to drive business outcomes and demonstrated experience in Agile delivery and capable of working with business and IT teams to prioritise work is a requirement. Previous experience in HR systems or Workforce Mgt systems advantageous.
But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and experience, our people work together and champion the Target values and behaviours.  We are a business where our values and people matter, and we need like-minded people to join us!
Target values diversity and we pride ourselves on representing the diverse and multicultural communities of which we are a part. 
Agencies will only be engaged if required. Please do not contact us or send applicants to us unless requested to by the Talent Acquisition Team.

job_description: About the Business Cartelux Australia is seeking an experienced Business Analyst/Tester for the company's proprietary platforms. With multiple products being launched into the global automotive, finance, insurance, and real estate industries, this position represents a truly unique opportunity to use their skill set to affect a positive and global impact.   About the role At Cartelux, we manage fast paced, high value projects. As a Business Analyst/Tester, you will be the main stakeholder on your project and you will be responsible for the scoping of the project, the gathering of the requirements and you will be the first or second point of contact for all customer interactions.  You will be able to maintain a close relationship with Business Stakeholder Representatives, working with them to analyse, communicate, test and validate requirements for the implementation or changes of the customized solution to the platform. Supported by our developer/architect you will define the final solution architecture, articulate it and ensure the follow up of their implementation.   Key Accountabilities   Analyse and capture requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task & workflow analysis.   Document the requirements using Cartelux project processes by utilising use cases, solution design and UX.   Lead workshops to drive detailed business requirements and conduct technical analysis of business requirements on project implementation engagements   Engage & communicate with business customers to understand their business and to anticipate needed solutions   Develop processes and strategies to ensure projects are delivered accurately, on time and to client satisfaction.   Coordinate and oversee the development with our technical team to ensure the delivery of the project   Perform quality assurance to ensure the quality of the deliveries   Assist in development of training materials   Support product manager, projects, sales team and technical team with new ideas, quotes and processes   Provide first line support to clients with requests, changes, issues and help using the platform   Monitor the implementation process and campaigns running on channels such as Google Ads, Facebook etc.   Be prepared to travel for key stakeholder meetings, if required.     Skills & Requirements    Business analyst/Tester role (3-4 years minimum)   Academic degree in IT, project management or business analysis (Other qualification considered)   Analytic & Business focus mind   Strong written and verbal communication   Feeling comfortable in client facing activities (Operational and C-level)   Eliciting & documenting business processes   Time management, negotiation & stakeholder engagement skills   Ability to work in a team and to collaborate with other members around project  Note:There is no visa sponsorship with this role, only candidates with Australian working rights will be considered.

job_description: Partner with your assigned business divisions to drive meaningful change delivering value to the people of NSWBe an influencer, decision-maker and expert advisor for complex IT projectsProgressive and dynamic organisation that supports flexible workingFixed term opportunity, based in Grafton   The opportunity    Are you an experienced IT Business Analyst looking for an opportunity to join an industry-leading organisation focused on delivering outcomes for the people of NSW?   Right now, we have a 12-month opportunity for an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our Business Services Technology Engagement team in Grafton.  Technology Engagement manages the end-to-end lifecycle of the Business journey from initial idea to delivery of solution, providing a simplified engagement with IT via dedicated relationship managers. Technology Engagement also converts customer needs to technology outcomes, listens to the requirements of key business stakeholders and translates those into solutions to provide value to the customer and the organisation while being the advocate for IT strategies and capabilities.   As part of the wider Technology Engagement Team you will be working with both business and IT stakeholders ensuring outcomes are understood and prioritised. It is an exciting time, and you in leading IT Innovation by defining and validating the appropriate solution architecture to ensure it aligns with our overall IT strategy and enterprise architecture.   As a trusted business partner and advocate you will be involved in:   The delivery of business analysis across a portfolio of complex initiatives to determine business requirements that support the definition of opportunities to be capitalised or problems to be resolved to optimise business performanceApplication of required modelling and analysis tools, methods and standards, giving special consideration to business perspectivesIdentifying and implementing solutions to business opportunities/problems on proposed and completed projects across a range of complex initiatives   About you    You are passionate about striving, pushing and advocating for the adoption of industry leading solutions, not simply maintaining the status quo.  You’ve got what it takes to understand highly complex and inter-related technical domains to effectively convey information to multiple audiences.    You have relevant technology, business, project management and/or equivalent experience with demonstrated experience in business analysis. It is essential that you can demonstrate experience analysing business needs and in interpreting and translating analysis results into insightful, clear and succinct technical specifications and requirement documentation.    Your strong knowledge of and extensive experience in the application of business analysis best-practice frameworks such as BABOK, Object Oriented Analysis & Design (e.g. UML), and business architecture (BPM, CBM, capability mapping, etc.) will support your success in this role.    If you understand the challenges of delivering high quality customer focused services, have the ability to operate effectively within a complex work environment and enjoy establishing and managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders, this is the right opportunity for you.     Please note, this role is fixed term for 12 months, based in Grafton and will require regional travel.    To get a complete profile of the role, please click here.    About us Transport for NSW is responsible for coordinating transport services used by over 7.5 million residents, 800,000 businesses and 30 million visitors every year. Transport comprises several divisions which coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do.    Interested?    If you’re ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role we want to hear from you.  Find out more about Transport for NSW here.     Our Commitment to Diversity   Great people come from all walks of life. At Transport for NSW, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.    We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation.    Benefits   When you join Transport for NSW, you become part of a forward-thinking organisation that offers generous working conditions, flexible working options and a real commitment to developing your skills.  For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here. The salary for this position is USS 10 ($123,229 - $134,668) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.    To apply   Simply submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than two pages) which must addresses the following statements:   Using an example describe your experience in the facilitation of groups during planning and design activities, change management activitiesDescribe a time you have partnered with a business stakeholder to drive meaningful change and challenged the status quoLocation - Grafton  Need help?   For a confidential discussion, please contact Liz Moore on 0437 826 135 or liz.moore@transport.nsw.gov.au (Ref 7LHD).   For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here.    Applications close: 11:59pm Monday 17 February 2020

job_description:
Digital Business Analyst
Bauer Media is Australia’s leading multi-platform publisher, with investments spanning magazines, digital and live experiences. The portfolio includes some of the country’s longest-running and most successful brands, including Australian Women’s Weekly, Woman’s Day, Harper’s Bazaar, Gourmet Traveller, House & Garden and many more.
About the role The role of the Digital Business Analyst is to facilitate and contribute to the Bauer digital agile delivery process for applications and services in the digital product and technology team. Carrying out duties across requirements capture, build, test, delivery and support.
 Duties

Facilitate scrum delivery activities including stand-up, estimation, elaboration, review, retro, continuous improvement and reporting.
Facilitate effective communication between business product and technical delivery.
Work with product team in stakeholder meetings, interviews or workshops to elicit and refine requirements.
Engage developers in the requirements and design processes.
Excellent ability to prepare and groom user story, test, technical and support documents. User Stories are accurate, logically split into tasks and fully identify the feature or situation in a testable way.
Perform test activities as needed. Provide as required to allow the technical team to create automated tests.
Provide 2nd level support as a subject matter expert in digital products. Investigate bugs and issues found in test or reported by users. Collaborate with team to find the root cause and solutions.
Prepare technical, user and training documentation for products.
Further skills and experience by working closely with leaders.

Essential Experience

2+ years’ digital business analyst experience in Agile product development environments.
Scrum master experience.
Requirements and functionality testing experience.
Tertiary qualification in a related field.
An understanding of SEO principles.
An exceptional eye for detail with all work.
A positive attitude to overcoming obstacles and getting results.
Strong analytical and modelling skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Preparation of acceptance criteria and test scenarios. 

Desirable

Experience working in or with a media organisation.
General understanding of application programming, database and system design.
An interest in new and emerging digital product technologies.

Why Bauer? 
You’ll receive preferred rate to the gym and swimming pool at Park Street, regular beauty perks and discounts at many restaurants, cafes and shops as well as access to the Bauer training opportunities. 
Please apply now and send your CV via the link.

job_description: REF# 317387 Contract:  Est start 2/3/2020 until 30/6/2020 | Possible extension  About the Client The Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) maintains an impartial and independent electoral system for eligible voters through active electoral roll management, efficient delivery of polling services and targeted education and public awareness programs.    About the Role The AEC is seeking to engage a Senior Business Analyst to support the Election Systems Modernisation Program team. The Election Systems Modernisation Program (Program) is a broad program of work to analyse current state capabilities and provide opportunities for improvement in the delivery of election and roll management services. The Senior Business Analyst will work in a team of business analysts, with a focus on analysing the business from both user and business outcomes perspectives for the Program. This work is critical to the overall success of the Program and will support and influence key outcomes for the AEC. The Senior Business Analyst reports to the User Requirements Stream Lead and will be required to help guide and mentor a team of Business Analysts, fostering an innovative, enjoyable and productive culture. The Senior Business Analyst will be expected to develop a firm understanding of the holistic business current state and desired outcomes, working with business Subject Matter Experts for domain expertise. While some key activities to be undertaken by the role include what could be considered standard business analyst work (i.e. the development of business process models, workflows, requirements mapping and traceability, stakeholder engagement, reporting and planning activities) this not a ‘typical’ business analyst role. The Program is not seeking a technically minded resource to define system functionality. The Senior Business Analyst is required to take an outcomes-based approach to representing the business capabilities and users. This role is different. The Program is seeking candidates for consideration who:  have a desire to define and deliver real outcomes; are comfortable working with ambiguity; are not beholden to a particular methodology; want to make an impact and contribute to a project that is enacting real change; will contribute to the collaborative Program culture; and are committed to making this Program team a great place to work.  The Program expects to challenge our personnel with new thinking and to be challenged ourselves. The Senior Business Analyst will need to engage and communicate widely across the business, meaning stakeholder engagement and management skills are essential. Success for this role will rely on:  the individual candidate’s ability to deliver in a fast paced and highly dynamic environment; the overall cultural fit of the candidate for the Program and broader AEC; and a candidate’s ability to challenge and drive thinking in new directions.  Key Position Responsibilities  Plan and document user interviews, eliciting both high level and detailed business problems and analysing root causes. Identify business and user needs. Analyse and improve user experience, taking the viewpoint of the user. Design and facilitate workshops and interviews that include a variety of internal and external stakeholders across all levels. Managing stakeholder groups to develop a partnership with the business and foster a productive working environment. Transform defined business needs into outcomes and problem statements, for large scale Government applications and complex systems. Communicate using professional judgement, evaluating risks and in the context of a complex and changing environment. Perform additional duties or assume responsibility of functions as directed by the Management from time to time. Foster a positive workplace culture. Assist in mentoring and upskilling less experienced team members.     About You Qualification, Skills and Experience  Proven ability to plan, run and document user interviews, eliciting both high level and detailed business problems and analysing root causes. Proven ability to translate business and user needs, using various methods (including Jobs To Be Done methodology), to describe outcomes instead of technical and functional requirements. Experience taking the viewpoint of the user then analysing and improving user experience. Proven ability to work as part of a collaborative and highly motivated team. Proven ability to deliver in a project and program environment under limited guidance. Proven ability to identify and plan capability maturity improvements and business process improvements. Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate between business and technical terminology. Proven ability to communicate with influence, negotiate outcomes and manage complex stakeholder relationships. Demonstrated personal drive and integrity whilst achieving results within legislative parameters. Experience in and desire to mentor and upskill less experienced team members. 5+ years’ experience as a Senior Business Analyst.  Police check and signed Declaration of Neutrality required for successful candidateTo Apply - Please press the appropriate button on this page or give one of our friendly team members a call on 1300 946 471.

It is a place of great natural beauty and offers an enviable lifestyle and positive work-life balance.Why Work for Shoalhaven City Council?Shoalhaven City Council is a dynamic organisation serving a large and diverse community; limitless opportunity exists for an exciting and rewarding career.We are committed to creating a positive culture and strong team environment, and offer a range of benefits:Generous Leave EntitlementsLong Service Leave After 5 Years9 Day Fortnight for Outdoor StaffFlexitime for Indoor StaffFitness PassportNovated Lease ArrangementsDiscounted Private Health InsuranceTraining and Development ProgramsAbout the roleAre you an experienced IT professional? We are seeking a motivated and experienced individual to join the Business Systems team.This permanent, full time position is situated within the Information Services section of Finance, Corporate & Community Services. The hours of work are 35 hours per week, Monday to Friday (9:00am to 5:00pm) at the Nowra Administration Building.What will you be doing?Reporting directly to the Unit Manager – Business Systems, the focus of this position is to:To work closely with all Sections/Units to ensure systems are used and function at the highest level to produce an excellent Customer Experience for the Shoalhaven community.Deliver technology solutions to clients under the direction of the Unit Manager, Business SystemsContribute to the implementation of the objectives of the Information Services Section.Drive technological solutions, and project manage change initiatives.What we are looking for?In order to be successful in the position, you will be/ possess:A motivated individual who wishes to enact positive change and enhance our customers experience.Tertiary qualification in Business Systems or an Information Technology related field with a business component and/or relevant industry experience.Demonstrated practical experience in the Information Technology industry.Proven ability to analyse and document new & current business requirements, processes, procedures and work practices.Demonstrated experience in data mining, modelling, analysis and reporting across a multi-faceted business environment.Class C Driver’s LicenceSee job description for further informationHow to ApplyYou will be required to upload your resume and a brief cover letter which should address the selection criteria as outlined in the job description.During the application you will also be required to respond to position related questions as shown below and questions regarding general information about you.At Shoalhaven City Council our corporate core values are: Collaboration, Adaptability, Integrity and Respect. Please choose one value and advise how you have enacted this value in a professional setting.Please describe your skills and experience relevant to this position.What is the most significant IT transformation project you have worked on, and what role did you play in its’ implementation?What is the most important skill a Business Analyst can bring into a project, and how do you demonstrate this skill?Contact: Peter Aney - Unit Manager – Business Systems – (02) 4429 3283Applications Close: Sunday, 1 March 2020 (at Midnight)When your application has been submitted completely, you will receive a confirmation email

job_description: Business Process Analyst - Head Office The Role!The Business Process Analyst reports directly to the Senior Manager Transformational Change and is responsible for establishing and leading strategic initiatives, including launching new products and services, application development, systems integration, operational efficiency improvements, process reengineering, and infrastructure upgrades and deployments. It has a reputation for being flexible, personable and being able to make the complex simple. With roots in regional NSW and head offices located in Armidale and Wauchope, Regional Australia Bank has grown to be one of the premier banking alternatives to the 'Big Four' banks.So, if you've got the skills and are passionate about people and creating a better, more sustainable place to live, then connect with us at Regional Australia Bank! Because we feel that being connected with regional Australia and its people are without doubt the most compelling and inspiring parts of our brand. In fact, the success of our business is determined by how well we share our passion for championing regional prosperity, including the financial prosperity of the people residing in it. Skills & Experience!With a sound skill set in project management, business skills, leadership, data analytics, budgeting and analysis, the Business Process Analyst will be pivotal in supporting the ongoing development of the organisational culture, driving the adoption and the maturity of project process and ideation disciplines. Essential:1. A relevant qualification with substantial project management expertise and/or an equivalent alternate combination of relevant knowledge, training and/or experience 2. Demonstrated ability to implement business change in a complex and sensitive environment4. Highly developed interpersonal skills including negotiation and liaison skills plus effective conceptual, analytical and problem solving skills particularly with the respect to solving and influencing complex organisational, procedural and policy issues.5. Ability to communicate technical issues in a way that they are relevant and understandable to a non-technical audience. Excellent writing, communication, presentation (public speaking), reporting and documentation skillsNow!If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you! Submit your cover letter and resume.Applications close Monday 24th February 2020 at 5pm.

job_description:
Together we create, innovate and collaborate
Working in partnership
Achieving world-class operational performance

Challenge yourself with us:
We’re proud to be the largest gold producer listed on the Australian Stock Exchange. From our Head Office in Melbourne, we work closely with our operations both local and global to safely operate and grow.
With a focus on diversity and inclusion, we develop and empower our people to deliver superior returns. Our differences, together with our collective experience allows us to creatively take on the challenges of our complex business.
Who we’re looking for:
As a Senior Business Analyst – Business Development, you will be responsible for a range of activities associated with the identification, analysis, and execution of external growth and portfolio optimisation opportunities. You will be providing high quality analytical and transaction execution support to the senior members of the Business Development team.
To be successful in this role; you will come from business development, corporate finance, investment banking, management consulting or private equity background with solid transaction execution experience. A proven performer, you will work closely with the Senior Leadership team, subject matter experts and external advisors.
Responsibilities include:

Assist with the identification, analysis, and execution of M&A, Joint Ventures, Exploration Farm-ins, and Portfolio Optimisation opportunities
Provide analysis and evaluation of M&A opportunities, including valuing mining projects, assets, operations, and companies, assessing key investment risks & opportunities, and undertaking business combination analysis
Execution of M&A and Portfolio Optimisation opportunities, including leading and managing various Due Diligence workstreams, preparation of presentation materials and papers

The ideal candidate will hold a tertiary qualification in a commerce/law-related discipline or a technical qualification (engineering, maths, applied science) with significant experience in business development, corporate finance, investment banking, management consulting or private equity.
Other requirements include:

Experience in the resource sector and financial modelling and evaluation
Highly developed analytical skills
Prior experience in strategy, valuations, corporate finance, and mergers & acquisitions
Confidence in preparing reports and documentation including Board papers
Knowledge of the mining industry in order to support the delivery of competitor analysis and reporting on activity and events across the sector

Our commitment to you
At Newcrest, things are always evolving. You’ll find yourself navigating and learning from our complex business every day.
Each of our work environments is challenging in their own right. No matter what your role with us, a strong will and resilience will take you further. No matter what pathway you choose to explore, you’ll be part of an experience like no other.

We encourage all candidates to discuss what flexibility means to you and how we can help you find your balance.   There’s plenty of other perks, too; Free Roadside Assistance, significant discounts on Banking, Assistance, Insurance and Travel products for you and your family Significant discounts on holidays, theme parks, movies, new cars, experiences and so much more  Ready to apply? job_description:
Panthera Finance is a rapidly growing Fintech company with offices in Brisbane, Gold Coast, Melbourne, Echuca and Manila. We invest in technology to keep ourselves at the forefront of our industry and focus on development to take advantage of new opportunities in the marketplace.
We are growing! One of the most exciting aspects of our growth are two of our internal technology products. With any growth comes the need to streamline, optimise, improve and automate. To that effect, we are looking an experienced Business Analyst to expand our team. This new role will have high levels of influence as we transform our Way of Working.About the role:
Elicit and analyse/evaluate business requirements
Facilitate ceremonies, including stand-ups, elaboration sessions, sprint planning, showcases, retros and workshops, encouraging team members and stakeholders to share ideas and participate

Champion the adoption of automation and continuous improvement

Assist in identifying opportunities for business and process improvement, cost savings and improved efficiency
Assist with release coordination

Minimum 2 years experience as a Business Analyst working in Agile teams
Strong understanding of SDLC
An ability to develop positive working relationships and manage stakeholder expectations
Strong written and verbal communication including technical writing skills
Demonstrable leadership skills
A knack for balancing conflicting priorities in a high-pressure environment
Demonstrable planning, organizational, and time management skills
An ability to think outside the box
Passionate about delivering results
Experience with Agile tools such as Azure DevOps, Jira
What’s in it for you?
Dynamic and passionate CIO
Growing company with opportunities for progression
Have significant influence in the workplace
Progressive team culture with lots of talent
Free onsite Barista, coffee to your desk
Discounted gym memberships

job_description: The Business Analyst is accountable to the Manager, Architecture and Business Consulting Branch. The purpose of this position is to carry out a full range of business analysis tasks including:  Investigation, analysis, and documentation of business change needs requiring ICT business requirements elicitation and documentation. Contribution to market research activities to identify candidate technology solutions. Business case development for initiatives approval, funding and prioritisation. Requirements specification for tenders and other types of procurement documentation. System requirements specification for bespoke development or products configuration. Assessment of requests to enhance production systems, in accordance to strategic direction for existing investments. In addition, the Business Analyst will collaborate on the design and implementation of appropriate solutions, and will assess and validate them against requirements. The Business Analyst may also undertake other specific analysis and research tasks to support the ICT Planning activity when required. The Architecture and Business Consulting Services Branch within the Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) Service:  Develops and maintains SAPOL ICT Strategy, and contributes to the development of plans to execute that strategy. Provides business consulting services for identification of business initiatives requiring ICT support and development of requirements, solution proposals, specifications and tendering. Assists areas in SAPOL with the development of business cases for IT solutions. Develops and maintains the Enterprise Architecture for SAPOL. Provides strategic advice when making technology decisions. Provides integration and solution architecture services for SAPOL enterprise applications. Develops and provides support to SAPOL’s corporate Data Warehouse and reporting services. Develops and maintains SAPOL’s geo-spatial services. Central Sydney Location
Iconic Australian Retail Brand

About the company
Your new company is Australia's leading retail giant, innovating their product and service offerings by leveraging cutting-edge technology. With a customer-forward value approach, this organisation champions culture within all aspects of their businesses. A renowned high-profile company delivering innovative technology projects.
About the role
Your company is looking for a seasoned business analyst to work across a large business de-merger project, working cross multiple streams within a fast-paced and changing environment, adhering to strict deadlines. You will be reporting to the Head of Separations who is overseeing the project. You will engage with all business project stakeholders and will have to be able to take in the vastly diverse projects in a short amount of time to take ownership. You will work with legal, commercial and finance teams. You will need a strong command of stakeholder management.

Senior business analyst with minimum 8 years' experience
Experience working with multiple projects simultaneously on a large scale
Large enterprise environment experience
Experience working with legal, compliance and finance teams

Strong stakeholder management skills to work with diverse and opposing business units
Exceptional communication both verbal and written in engagement and documentation
Strong facilitator to run workshops and presentations

Culture
This organisation prides in their inclusive and fun culture that reflects the changing needs of the workplace by embracing flexibility and promoting best-practice embedded into all processes. You will enjoy not only the fun and modern physical environment but the collaborative and open culture that supports career growth and opportunities. 
Benefit

Great Culture - flexibility
Exciting business critical project
Lucrative Day rate
Long-term development opportunities within the organisation 

How to Apply
Click APPLY or contact Vanessa Min - Key Account Manager - at vanessa.m@interpropeople.com for a confidential discussion

job_description: **Must be Australian Citizen to be considered**  We are seeking  2 or 3 IT Business Analysts to support the work required in the Modernisation of Business Registers program for a period of 6 months.  You will be working mainly to facilitate business workshops, capture and manage technical requirements.  You will be responsible for: • Working closely with business SMEs and IT development teams to elicit and analyse business requirements to discover the underlying business need to be addressed and information related to the product and project requirements, through structured conversations and workshops with stakeholders.  • Specifying Requirements and User stories (business, functional and non-functional) – documenting the requirements and acceptance criteria in a format that can be shared with, and easily understood by, a variety of stakeholders (Business, Executive, Application and Solution Designer resources, Development resources and Testing resources).  • Developing User Interface Designs – utilising User Centred Design (UCD) principles and practices to design User Interfaces that conform to industry-based and Australian Government Accessibility and Usability principles, practices and guidelines.  • Facilitating working with business SMEs to elicit requirements and in conjunction with developers present proofs of concepts/prototypes to support these requirements.  • Improving overarching Business Analysis capability by building employee knowledge and skills as well as developing, implementing, and supporting methodologies, standards, and tools for requirements, process management and data management.  • Displaying strong skills in managing your own tasks and performance to deliver on strategic priorities and team business plan.  KNOWLEDGE AND TECHNICAL SKILLS    Excellent technical specialist knowledge of IT Systems Development Lifecycles (SDLC) with Agile methodology experience. Comprehensive knowledge and skills sets associated with eliciting, documenting and managing requirements. Excellent technical skills in process modelling (including experience utilising BPMN or LEAN principles) and data analysis and modelling. Good UCD (User Centred Design) skills and the ability to apply them to UI/UX design. Excellent application of analytical and problem solving skills in IT systems and IT delivery. Excellent stakeholder management and liaison skills. Good knowledge of, or the ability to quickly acquire knowledge of systems and underlying technologies such as Microsoft Dynamics, Java, Siebel/Oracle fusion, Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), PeopleSoft, and Lotus Notes is desirable. Good understanding of, or the ability to quickly develop an understanding of role, strategic priorities and processes, including  administrative and legislative framework.  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and be accountable for outcomes.   PLS APPLY FOR FULL PD

job_description: About the role The VEC has an opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to lead, manage and coordinate a range of business initiatives and projects for the IT branch. This role will oversee the quality, planning, scoping and estimating of all Business Analyst deliverables. The Lead Business Analyst is responsible for:  leading and managing a team of Business Analysts (>5 direct reports) actively engaging with stakeholders to manage any conflicts and changes in priority to ensure that stakeholders and project team members remain in agreement on solution scope and deliverables, leading business stakeholders towards functional design decisions, ensuring a high standard of quality, thoroughness and detail throughout BA deliverables and superior quality documentation assisting in the development of user-centric business requirements that are credible and complete, and contributing to planning activities by representing the business priorities and imperatives. What you will bring to the role To be successful in this role you will ideally have previous experience as a senior Business Analyst with well-developed leadership and coaching skills. You have excellent stakeholder management skills with the ability to facilitate and positively influence strategy, business requirements and solution development. You have outstanding written and verbal communication skills and previous experience with program management and possess the ability to manage multiple streams of work. The VEC's core values drive the way we work to achieve our vision. We are looking for someone who can model our five values: Independence, Accountability, Respect, Collaboration and Innovation. How to apply All applicants must submit:  a current CV and a separate document with responses to Key Selection Criteria 4.1, 4.2, 4.4, 4.5 and 4.6 as listed in the position description. The VEC can only accept applications via the Victorian government careers website. Applications close at 11:59pm on Sunday 23 February 2020. The VEC is an equal opportunity employer*.  We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.  As a ‘Child Safe' organisation the VEC is also committed to the health, wellbeing and safety of children and young people. This commitment is taken seriously, and all employees are expected to be aware of and comply with this commitment. Successful applicants will be required to satisfy character clearance requirements, including but not limited to a national police check and working with children check. * In accordance with Section 17A of the Electoral Act 2002, the VEC may ask applicants for disclosure of specific political activities that could compromise the perceived independence of the organisation. Please read the Disclosure of Political Activities Fact Sheet before applying.

job_description:
Together we create, innovate and collaborate
Working in partnership
Achieving world-class operational performance

Challenge yourself with us:
We’re proud to be the largest gold producer listed on the Australian Stock Exchange. From our Head Office in Melbourne, we work closely with our operations both local and global to safely operate and grow.
With a focus on diversity and inclusion, we develop and empower our people to deliver superior returns. Our differences, together with our collective experience allows us to creatively take on the challenges of our complex business.
Who we’re looking for:
As a Senior Business Analyst – Business Development, you will be responsible for a range of activities associated with the identification, analysis, and execution of external growth and portfolio optimisation opportunities. You will be providing high quality analytical and transaction execution support to the senior members of the Business Development team.
To be successful in this role; you will come from business development, corporate finance, investment banking, management consulting or private equity background with solid transaction execution experience. A proven performer, you will work closely with the Senior Leadership team, subject matter experts and external advisors.
Responsibilities include:

Assist with the identification, analysis, and execution of M&A, Joint Ventures, Exploration Farm-ins, and Portfolio Optimisation opportunities
Provide analysis and evaluation of M&A opportunities, including valuing mining projects, assets, operations, and companies, assessing key investment risks & opportunities, and undertaking business combination analysis
Execution of M&A and Portfolio Optimisation opportunities, including leading and managing various Due Diligence workstreams, preparation of presentation materials and papers

The ideal candidate will hold a tertiary qualification in a commerce/law-related discipline or a technical qualification (engineering, maths, applied science) with significant experience in business development, corporate finance, investment banking, management consulting or private equity.
Other requirements include:

Experience in the resource sector and financial modelling and evaluation
Highly developed analytical skills
Prior experience in strategy, valuations, corporate finance, and mergers & acquisitions
Confidence in preparing reports and documentation including Board papers
Knowledge of the mining industry in order to support the delivery of competitor analysis and reporting on activity and events across the sector

Our commitment to you
At Newcrest, things are always evolving. You’ll find yourself navigating and learning from our complex business every day.

job_description: The Role As a Business Analysts working for BAPL you will be engaged in exciting assignments across a wide range of industries and sectors, supporting Australia’s most innovative organisations to deliver high-profile projects where the focus is the outcome. job_description: Business Analyst - TMF  Location: Newcastle OR Parramatta, NSW Type: Permanent, Full-Time.   Our business, our culture QBE Insurance Group is one of the world's top 20 general insurance and reinsurance companies, with operations in all the key insurance markets. QBE is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange and is headquartered in Sydney. We employ more than 12,000 people in 31 countries. Working at QBE, we recognise the value of diversity and inclusion in the workplace and support a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance. We offer you a dynamic workplace culture, one that values and leverages the unique ideas, capabilities and experiences you bring irrespective of where you are in the world. We believe this strengthens our ability to deliver on our business goals, particularly as it relates to innovation, growth and our focus on customers. The opportunity We have an exciting new opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join our Treasury Managed Fund division on a permanent, full-time basis in Newcastle. In this role you will partner with key stakeholders across IfNSW and QBE to develop reports and IT solutions to evaluate performance outcomes. Your responsibilities will include:  Ensuring business reporting needs are met and analysing data metrics Streamlining and improving internal and external reporting suite Understanding lead indicators for results and designing analytical tools that support the business, to adapt to emerging trends Interpreting legislation and contract terms, and applying them to build value-adding monitoring tools What does success look like?  Solid experience in IT and proven experience in a Business Analyst position Experience within the insurance industry would be highly desirable Proven experience with Data analysis & Process mapping Ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate technical solutions Technical knowledge of programming, system design, IT infrastructure and database concepts A strong sense of accountability and desire to improve quality of reports, accuracy of data and data integrity Benefits? At QBE, you will be provided with a competitive remuneration structure and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning. We offer a range of benefits and discounts including:  Shared-Care leave (inclusive of paid superannuation during this time) Secondment opportunities Employee assistance programme Paid volunteer leave Purchased leave Product discounts This is a superb opportunity to progress your career as part of a progressive team in a broad-ranging role with scope for career development long term. If you are looking for a new and exciting opportunity, meet the above criteria and believe you have the right attributes to succeed in this role, please click the APPLY button now using the link below. Internal applicants, please advise your manager before making a formal application. Successful applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment. As part of QBE’s inclusive culture, we strongly encourage applications across all cultural backgrounds, genders and abilities. Applications close COB Tuesday 11th February 2020.

job_description: Company description:CitiPower and Powercor Australia are electricity distributors and supply power to more than one million Victorians. We own and manage the technology - poles, wires, meters and distributed technologies such as storage - that deliver electricity to homes and businesses within Melbourne’s CBD, its suburbs and across central and western Victoria.Job description:Why work for us? Join the team that owns and manages Australia’s three leading electricity distribution networks and be part of a company that makes a real difference to the communities we service.When you join our business, your work-life balance and career development are high priorities. We place emphasis on your development through diverse training programs, leadership courses and internal opportunities.  Some of our benefits:  Exposure to industry leading practices within a strong company A great incentives package including an annual performance bonus, health and fitness subsidy, salary packaging options and much more…. A supportive team culture  About the opportunity: We have more than one permanent opportunity available for experienced  IT Business Analysts to join our team.Using your extensive experience in Business analysis and appropriate application of BA frameworks, you will partner with the Business and IT Stakeholders to define, develop and implement IT solutions that support business outcomes.This role is focused on being part of the team analysing data to better inform business decisions and finding technological solutions to business needs.  It is a busy role, working in a Company that is focused on leading technical change and innovation.With more than one opportunity available this is an opportunity not to be passed up! Further responsibilities in this role will include:  Define business opportunities, whilst identifying and assessing alternative options, analysing business and financial considerations, articulating drivers, opportunities and constraints to then better recommend  appropriate solutions Conduct business process and functional analysis to determine business requirements, ensuring prioritisation and developing impact analysis to inform change management Use high levels of communication skills to present and articulate the overall solution design, documenting process, conducting analysis and liaising with appropriate stakeholders Support the full scope of design, development and execution of test plans, and user testing to ensure system acceptance and that scope is meeting requirements Ensure successful implementation and continue to support and manage system change and continuous improvements.  About you  Proven solid experience in a similar role as a Business Analyst, with full experience with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), and working in the application of BA frameworks. A great communicator that has experience in organisational change management, with a solid understanding of business operations, and has worked within a similar industry Degree qualified (or equivalent) in IT, business management or commerce  About CitiPower, Powercor and United Energy CitiPower, Powercor and United Energy are committed to providing customers with safe, reliable and affordable electricity supplies.  We own, operate and maintain the network assets of poles, manage network safety, particularly in relation to bushfire risks, and provide metering services to 1.7 million homes and businesses within Melbourne’s CBD, inner and eastern suburbs, the Mornington Peninsula and across central and western Victoria.Our networks are the most cost-efficient in the country, rated first, second and fourth by the Australian Energy Regulator based on total productivity.  Importantly, this has enabled us to reduce average long-term electricity network charges to customers while we develop our networks for the future. If you possess the required skills and experience and you are looking for a fantastic permanent opportunity please submit your application by C.O.B 17th February 2020 Profile description:Are you an engaged Business Analyst ready to join an innovative team & contribute to IT success?

job_description: The Organisation Our client is a large construction company who has recently embarked on a large program of migration and integration work. This program is surrounding the improvement of organisational efficiencies through various implementations and upgrades of applications. The Chief Information Officer has an impressive background in project management and business transformation and is striving to achieve a more positive customer experience, enhance user experience and increase compliance and controls in the business. The Role This role represents an excellent long-term opportunity to work with an organisation that is in an extremely exciting time and will offer continued professional development with a good work-life balance. This business analyst will focus on the following areas: - Mapping business processes “as-is” via a swim lane methodology- Understanding user requirements and how applications will transition to the “to-be” state- Ability to understand data flows between applications and how they integrate- Partnering with the business stakeholders to understand pain points- Assessing the risks of current and proposed processes- Developing a “to-be” scenario- Understanding and presenting tangible and intangible benefits of proposed “to-be” scenarios- Proposing work packages and business cases This position will offer stability and security through a long-term contract in the construction sector allowing career development in an environment that is encouraging of work-life balance and flexibility. Potential part time options can be considered. Your Profile You are an immediately available (or close to) Qualified Business Analyst with experience in process mapping and/or business case development in agile and waterfall environments. You will be able to communicate with stakeholders across IT and the business whilst providing initiative and intuitive thinking surrounding business process improvement. You must be able to understand the problem before trying to address the solution. You must be able to wear multiple hats and operate at a fast pace. This position will suit a person looking for longer term positions with the opportunity to still maintain a lifestyle outside of work whilst growing as a professional. Construction or engineering industry background would be highly advantageous. job_description: Simplot Australia Pty Limited (Simplot Australia) is a wholly owned subsidiary of the J.R. Simplot Company, a family-owned, multi-national food and agriculture business. Simplot Australia is trusted as one of the leading providers of quality, sustainable food for the ever-changing needs of consumers and customers in Australia, New Zealand and select Asia Pacific markets. We have built long term partnerships with Australian farmers and our unique and diverse product portfolio includes vegetable, meals and seafood manufacturing operations that supply chilled, frozen and shelf stable products to Australia's major supermarkets, hotels, restaurants and quick service restaurant customers. Our portfolio includes some of Australias most trusted and well-known brands including Birds Eye, Edgell, Leggos, John West, Chiko, I&J, Chicken Tonight, Five Brothers and Five Tastes. Summary We now have a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst (Agricultural Services) to support our dynamic and growing business based at our Devonport Plant. Reporting to the Finance Manager Procurement & Agricultural Services , you will be responsible for partnering with the Agricultural Services team in the development and execution of strategy by providing key financial, accounting and business data analysis, advice and recommendations. Key Responsibilities  Provides support in the coordination and consolidation of the Group financial planning processes including forecasting, annual plans, projections, capital and cash planning.  Coordinates the Group planning processes.  Helps assess the impact of plans on key financial metrics. Assumes a lead role in the development and communication of ad hoc financial and operational models, finance policies, assessment tools, and other business performance metrics. Develops new analytical models and methodologies for assessing business portfolio performance as directed. Develops risk management and assessment tools, conducts research on new methodologies/practices and proposes risk management alternatives. Provides support and conducts research pertaining to the accounting for derivatives and Fair Value accounting of certain assets/liabilities.  Prescreens new risk management activities for accounting and covenant compliance. Reviews capital investment analyses provided by group staff to ensure adherence to established analytical practices and policies.  Performs judgmental risk assessments of the proposals.  Experience Required To be successful in this role, you must have a growth mindset, the ability to challenge conventional thinking and influence broadly across the business. You are customer centric and understand the needs of your stakeholders. Working within a fast-paced environment, you are able to prioritise effectively across multiple projects [priorities] and be agile to move with adjusting targets. This position will partner with our Agricultural Services Division Leadership Team and Site Leadership Teams nationally, therefore you must hold the ability to work well within a team environment and build strong working relationships to build credibility and trust. You will ideally be tertiary qualified (Business or related discipline), have experience working within FMCG Supply Chain, including cost and management accounting and a minimum of 6 years experience across general accounting, financial analysis and management reporting.  Advanced Microsoft Office suite (especially excel) is a must in this role as is strong financial analysis, modelling and forecasting skills. Benefits and Culture •Option to purchase additional Annual Leave•Income protection Insurance•A Generous Parental Leave policy for Primary Carers •Access to EAP•A Variety of Flexible Work Arrangements•Awards recognising long serving and high achieving employees•Short Term Incentive Benefits for Employees•Offerings including Financial, Novated Leasing and Discounted Products and Services.​

job_description: About the project This large enterprise believes that without taking risk they are unable to grow.  Experiencing significant growth and change over the past few years with a more globally dispersed geographic footprint, they are upgrading their Risk Management platform to improve and modernise their governance, risk and compliance.    The role Working with SME’s, senior stakeholders, software vendors, and end-users, this contract position will lead the implementation of a new integrated risk management (IRM) to ensure successful execution. A continuous improvement mindset is required to work with key business stakeholders to define high-level business needs and analyse opportunities to enhance business processes and enrich the customer experience.  You will respectively challenge inefficiencies in process and workflow to establish a strong foundation from which to scale up and build future use cases and ensure that all technical specifications are aligned to ‘future-proof’ the system from bugs and inefficiencies.    Your experience  Demonstrated experience delivering similar projects, ideally with Compliance Management Software or Independent Risk Management systems Have strong writing and documentation skills with experience capturing, documenting and implementing business requirements Excellent facilitation skills and experience conducting stakeholder workshops Experience achieving improvements to business processes by analysis and design, therefore gaining the support and buy-in from business stakeholders Ability to define critical business workflows in the design and development of visual models and work-flow diagrams Proficiency in IT systems and navigating back-end functionality Experience working with software vendors and the ability to develop effective working relationships with internal and external partners. Demonstrated analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills with the ability to formulate concepts The ability to influence and negotiate with clear verbal and written communication, skills Organised and proactive self-starter with strong initiative and sense of ownership and responsibility Experience working within open and highly collaborative agile environments     You must have approved Australian Work rights to be considered for this position.     For more information or a confidential chat, please contact Linda Apostolidis on 0420 845 795 or via la@asr.com.au

job_description: About Engineers Australia Join the most influential organisation for the engineering profession, we are a national organisation that is continually growing domestically and internationally. Our brand is highly recognised as the peak professional body, ‘the voice of the engineering profession’, so much so that we also partner with the Australian Government to strategically deliver services and outcomes.   About the role: You will be lucky enough to be based in the heart of the parliamentary triangle with unlimited Nespresso coffee is all at your fingertips. Based in Barton, you will have access to the delectable eateries of National Circuit.  As the Business Analyst, you will require a strong understanding of business processes as well as a technical capacity to derive value through aligning these with current and planned ICT activities. This role is key in identifying and delivering successful business outcomes with a strong focus on customer experience.   Your contributions to our team will include but are not limited to:  Meeting with key business stakeholders to understand business needs, gather information and analyse requirements Work closely with stakeholders and change management to identify impacts to business processes as a result of system or application changes Develop business process mapping and develop as-is / to-be results through engagement with ICT staff and business staff across Engineers Australia as needed to ensure appropriate business opportunity is aligned with technical capability and is identified and documented Create and develop BA artefacts Operate proactively with the business to analyse business requirements and specify appropriate technical solutions in accordance with Engineers Australia’s ICT strategy   Our ideal candidate  Tertiary qualifications in Business, commerce, ICT or related, field coupled with at least 5 years’ experience in Business Analysis & Process Improvement. Prefer BABOK or Six Sigma certification or similar; Demonstrated understanding of data and information architecture, and ability to develop workable solutions that meet business requirements; SDLC Skills with strong Agile to ensure activities follow best practise methodologies and outcomes; Demonstrated experience developing and utilizing effective project development artefacts; Demonstrated experience with cloud based systems; Outstanding verbal and written communications skills to elicit needs and develop business artefacts to support successful business outcomes.   Culture & Benefits As a learning organisation, we promote self-development and highly encourage you to undertake learning and development opportunities as they arise. Do you also have ideas to further your development? We would love to know!  As an employee at Engineers Australia, you will have access to a broad suite of staff benefits.   Want to apply or know more? Come and see why Engineers Australia has been attracting and retaining some of the best in the industry! Click on 'Apply for this job' below. Applications with tailored cover letters are preferred. For a confidential discussion about this opportunity, please send an email to Lilian Elkess: LElkess@engineersaustralia.org.au and cc in HR@engineersaustralia.org.au Please visit the Engineers Australia website to view a full copy of the Position Description http://www.engineersaustralia.org.au/work-for-engineers-australia   Your privacy Please visit the Engineers Australia website to view important information regarding the Engineers Australia's Privacy Policy in relation the collection of information: http://www.engineersaustralia.org.au/work-for-engineers-australia By submitting an application for employment or expression of interest with us you and/or by making a job enquiry, you:  acknowledge that you have read and understood that Engineers Australia or its third party providers may collect personal information about you in the manner and for the purposes described in our Privacy Policy (https://www.engineersaustralia.org.au/Privacy-Policy) consent to Engineers Australia and its third party providers processing, collecting, using and disclosing your personal information as stated in the 'Engineers Australia's Privacy Policy in relation the Collection of Information' notice.

An exciting opportunity for Business Analyst to lead their way to Enterprise Asset Management implementation across the organisation. job_description: Business Analyst, 10 month contract. Government Organisation - Parramatta/Macquarie Park $550-630/day + super  Your new company Work for the NSW Government in a contract role until December 2020 and join the PMO supporting a variety of projects. This role will suit someone who has worked on business improvement, regulatory or compliance style projects.  Your new role A busy and varied role, responsibilities will include;Working with the stakeholder group to identify requirements and map out possible solutionsReview existing business processes, gap analysis and recommend improvement measuresDevelop and implement reports and controls delivering accurate and appropriate project reportsMonitor project performance and governance / compliance What you'll need to succeed In order to succeed you will need to have at least 12+ months experience as a Business Analyst. You will ideally have exposure to working for the NSW Government and will have worked on business-led projects. Please note, this is not an IT Business Analyst. You will be a confident communicator, happy to host workshops and deal with change-adverse stakeholders.  What you'll get in return This role offers you the opportunity to work in a supportive environment but enjoy a high level of autonomy. It also gives you the change to learn more about working across PMO style projects.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV and Cally Holland will be in touch in due course. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.  SA Licence number : LHS 297508

job_description: Use your Functional Analysis skills Permanent Full-Time Opportunity Various Enterprise Projects Melbourne CBD Dialog is seeking a Business Analyst to join our Melbourne professional consulting team. We are seeking a person who will bring previous experience in functional analysis, configuring and customisation of MS Dynamics 365 and who has a focus on great delivery outcomes. This role will be working within an established team directly with a key client.  Criteria for selection will include:  Functional Analysis skills encompassing functional design through user stories, wire-frames, screen mock ups, Business Process Flow & Work Flow Demonstrated ability in requirements gathering and clarification and conducting presentations and workshops Good understanding of the benefits and key business drivers for using the MS Dynamics CRM product Exposure to Government ICT systems and processes highly advantageous About Dialog - As Australia's largest privately owned IT Services Company our key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies and methodologies. Dialog is a dynamic organisation which offers attractive career development to its people through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere. As a Dialog consultant engaging with these clients you will:  Work with key stakeholders to achieve world's best practice processes in major projects Work on a wide variety of interesting and challenging assignments Work with colleagues in partnership with clients who are committed to achieving their business objectives Enjoy salary above industry standard in a working environment in which effort, creativity and a positive attitude are highly valued Have extensive training opportunities through the Dialog Academy, which offers over 1,500 IT and 800 Business Skills courses Work with like-minded colleagues who share information and focus on the goal, driving the project and their careers further and faster At Dialog, our whole approach is based on four key values: Involved, Committed, Can Do, Always. It's these values, applied to every project, which stand behind our success and ensure we are always client focused. These same four values underpin the relationship we enjoy with our people.Join our team of professional, enthusiastic and experienced consultants, where communication, learning and knowledge sharing are prized. We offer an excellent benefits package. Dialog is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants should be Australian or NZ citizens or Australian permanent residents. If you are not an Australian or New Zealand citizen you will need to provide your passport and visa for our review. Visit our website www.dialog.com.au for more information.​

job_description: Work on an award-winning, international technology! Endless career opportunitiesAn innovative, friendly team of 300+ As a Business Analyst/ Project Manager you will enhance business systems by providing accurate information about business needs and priorities.  Intelligent Thought, our technology business is on the brink of shipping the next generation of Claim Logik. This product is going to be rolled out as the upgrade path for existing clients and will also be rolled out to new clients as the de-facto platform.  The growth of the platform and the increasing industry demand have led to the need for this role to help the team scale. Our PhilosophyGive each employee a sense of purpose and an environment for them to connect the importance of their role to delivering a service that matters to our customers.Challenge the ‘why’ of traditional claims processes.Keep it simple – do only what brings value and what matters to the customerEnable employee decisions, empower our people Your Responsibilities:Organise and run workshops with internal subject matter experts and define and document requirements for our products as per roadmaps, in collaboration with our product, technology, experience and delivery teams.Coordinate with country heads to define and document localization requirements as neededDefine and create ultra-lean project plans for project, portfolio, and product prioritization and implementationEvaluates trade-offs between project size and complexity, cost, urgency, risk, and stakeholder valuePartners with business sponsors to define success metrics and criteriaFacilitates all operational checkpoint activities throughout the lifecycle of projects – eg fortnightly showcases and release notificationsAssess, delegate and get resolution on all high priority project risks as they are encounteredEnsure all projects adhere to compliance standards that the company is required to meetContinually update relevant business stakeholders on project statuses Skills & experienceFormal training in project management 5+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst 5+ years' experience in Project ManagementExcellent facilitation, collaboration, negotiation, and presentation skillsComfort with ambiguity, frequent change, or unpredictabilityUnderstanding of agile software development lifecycle managementAbility to coach teams on the basis of project management and work with them to define and deliver to agreed milestonesWhy Claim Central? Claim Central Consolidated is a global insurance industry leader across, claims management, insurance technology and data and analytics. Currently operating in the  United States, Australia, South Africa, Italy and New Zealand, we have pioneered digitally connected claims management services across the globe. Claim Central is a disruptor and thought leader in the industry and we were recognised as the Australian Financial Review’s 8th Most Innovative Company in Australia in 2016. This business is in a period of unprecedented growth, transitioning our technology and services into multiple geographies at a rapid pace. Our unique culture is based on teamwork, collaboration, trust, respect and performance. We also offer many benefits apart from our exceptional team culture; including flexible work arrangements, and continued professional development.  Be a part of this journey in a career-defining role.  Matraville 2036 NSW

job_description: This is an outstanding opportunity to join a marketing leading Australian business which provides end to end project management services to a broad range of industrial clients. The enterprise has continued to grow, both organically and through acquisitions, and it is committed to ensuring that its corporate functions continue to evolve in order to meet the growing needs of the expanding business.This newly created fixed term appointment will be part of the Finance Group and will support the planning, design and implementation of a critical program of work within the Finance Shared Services function. Initially, you will be expected to critically assess current workstreams and to identify and document Business Unit requirements. Using your knowledge of Project Management methodologies, and working collaboratively with internal subject matter experts across Finance, Payroll and Human Capital Management, you will then be mandated to develop project guidelines for agreed programs of work, documenting a broad range of factors including resourcing, inter-relations, process and control frameworks, communication and accountabilities, project tracking, status reports and issue resolution.You will be an experienced project management professional who can bring a structured approach to the assessment, design and delivery of a novel Business Services platform within the Finance Shared Services function of a substantial enterprise. You should have the communication skills and the gravitas to work effectively with senior stakeholders and steering committees, and the relationship management skills to organise and leverage the internal resources that will be provided to deliver on the projects.  A solutions-focussed approach and the ability to get down to detail and facilitate outcomes in a dynamic operational environment are also critical. Prior experience in payroll-systems implementation projects would be beneficial but is not essential.For a strictly confidential discussion, please contact James McBeath on 03 8609 2056.  Alternatively, submit your application via the Apply button.

job_description:
(HEO9) $112,743 to $120,645 per annum plus an employer contribution of up to 17% superannuation may apply
Continuing position
Lead the Enterprise Business Analysis practice, providing critical advice and direction during the University's technology investment planning cycles
The role leads a team of Enterprise Business Analysts who provide business architecture and analysis expertise at the division/enterprise level to understand business needs, and develop and update technology investment proposals and plans in line with the University’s strategy and underlying business plans and, provide critical input into the solution, implementation and delivery of technical solutions.
The position is instrumental in leading the Enterprise Business Analysis practice and in coordinating and providing critical advice and direction during the University’s technology investment planning cycles.
To be successful you will need:

Extensive consulting experience that has fostered the ability to establish strong working relationships with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders to ensure collaborative work practices and influence required outcomes.
Experience in applying contemporary strategic management and business practices and methods to lead teams of professional staff in the planning of major, complex and/or multiple IT projects that support organisational goals.
Proven extensive ability to apply a range of Enterprise / Business analysis and facilitation methods to drive and guide discussion, and elicit business requirements that are consistent and aligned with corporate strategy.
Demonstrated ability to exercise a high degree of independent operational, strategic, problem solving and creative thinking and, a proven capacity to plan, prioritise and implement strategies for a large and complex organisation.
Demonstrated understanding and experience in Enterprise Analysis and Business Analysis practices and methods including capability models, maturity assessments and technology mapping.

Enjoy an outstanding career environment
The University of Adelaide is a uniquely rewarding workplace. The size, breadth and quality of our education and research programs - including significant industry, government and community collaboration - offers you vast scope and opportunity for a long, fulfilling career.
It also enables us to attract high-calibre people in all facets of our operations, ensuring you will be surrounded by talented colleagues, many world-leading. And our work's cutting-edge nature - not just in your own area, but across virtually the full spectrum of human endeavour - provides a constant source of inspiration.
Our core values are honesty, respect, fairness, discovery and excellence. And our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity. We are firm believers that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills of our staff.
In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.
Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/jobs
Your division's broader role
The Division of University Operations enables the University's delivery of high-quality and distinct learning, teaching and research experiences. Its responsibilities link to Adelaide's strategic plan and focus on people, community, assets and infrastructure, and processes.
Learn more at: adelaide.edu.au/operations
If you want to change tomorrow, act today
Click on the link below for a copy of the position description and to apply: (If no links appear, try viewing on another device)
https://careers.adelaide.edu.au/cw/en/job/503916/enterprise-business-analyst-lead
Please ensure you address and upload your responses to all selection criteria. Applications close 11:55pm, 27 February 2020.
For further information
For a confidential discussion regarding this position, contact:
Vince CondinaDirector, IT Strategy, Planning & Governance E: itdsjobs@adelaide.edu.au
The University of Adelaide is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who meet the requirements of this position are strongly encouraged to apply.
